label: Data
definitions: Information, represented in an information artefact (data record) that is 'understandable' by dedicated computational tools that can use the data as input or produce it as output.

label: Ontology
definitions: An ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations, a controlled vocabulary, structured glossary etc.

label: Identifier
definitions: A text token, number or something else which identifies an entity, but which may not be persistent (stable) or unique (the same identifier may identify multiple things).

label: Molecular mass
definitions: Mass of a molecule.

label: Molecular charge
definitions: Net charge of a molecule.

label: Chemical formula
definitions: A specification of a chemical structure.

label: QSAR descriptor
definitions: A QSAR quantitative descriptor (name-value pair) of chemical structure.

QSAR descriptors have numeric values that quantify chemical information encoded in a symbolic representation of a molecule. They are used in quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) applications. Many subtypes of individual descriptors (not included in EDAM) cover various types of protein properties.

label: Raw sequence
definitions: A raw molecular sequence (string of characters) which might include ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps and translation stop.

label: Sequence record
definitions: A molecular sequence and associated metadata.

label: Sequence set
definitions: A collection of multiple molecular sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to molecular sequence database records or entries and which (typically) are derived from some analytical method.
This concept may be used for arbitrary sequence sets and associated data arising from processing.

label: Sequence feature source
definitions: How the annotation of a sequence feature (for example in EMBL or Swiss-Prot) was derived.
This might be the name and version of a software tool, the name of a database, or 'curated' to indicate a manual annotation (made by a human).

label: Sequence search results
definitions: A report of sequence hits and associated data from searching a database of sequences (for example a BLAST search). This will typically include a list of scores (often with statistical evaluation) and a set of alignments for the hits.

The score list includes the alignment score, percentage of the query sequence matched, length of the database sequence entry in this alignment, identifier of the database sequence entry, excerpt of the database sequence entry description etc.

label: Sequence signature matches
definitions: Report on the location of matches in one or more sequences to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures.
This ncluding reports of hits from a search of a protein secondary or domain database.

label: Sequence signature data
definitions: Data concering concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences and the classifiers used for their identification, including sequence motifs, profiles or other diagnostic element.
This can include metadata about a motif or sequence profile such as its name, length, technical details about the profile construction, and so on.

label: Dotplot
definitions: A dotplot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.

label: Sequence alignment
definitions: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences.

label: Sequence similarity score
definitions: A value representing molecular sequence similarity.

label: Sequence alignment report
definitions: An informative report of molecular sequence alignment-derived data or metadata.
Use this for any computer-generated reports on sequence alignments, and for general information (metadata) on a sequence alignment, such as a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.

label: Profile-profile alignment
definitions: A profile-profile alignment (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

label: Sequence-profile alignment
definitions: Alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).
Data associated with the alignment might also be included, e.g. ranked list of best-scoring sequences and a graphical representation of scores.

label: Sequence distance matrix
definitions: A matrix of estimated evolutionary distance between molecular sequences, such as is suitable for phylogenetic tree calculation.
Methods might perform character compatibility analysis or identify patterns of similarity in an alignment or data matrix.

label: Phylogenetic character data
definitions: Basic character data from which a phylogenetic tree may be generated.
As defined, this concept would also include molecular sequences, microsatellites, polymorphisms (RAPDs, RFLPs, or AFLPs), restriction sites and fragments

label: Phylogenetic tree
definitions: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.
A phylogenetic tree is usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated. See also 'Phylogenetic tree image'.

label: Comparison matrix
definitions: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid or nucleotide sequence comparison.
The comparison matrix might include matrix name, optional comment, height and width (or size) of matrix, an index row/column (of characters) and data rows/columns (of integers or floats).

label: Secondary structure alignment (protein)
definitions: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more proteins.

label: RNA secondary structure
definitions: An informative report of secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.
This includes thermodynamically stable or evolutionarily conserved structures such as knots, pseudoknots etc.

label: Secondary structure alignment (RNA)
definitions: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more RNA molecules.

label: Structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a macromolecular tertiary (3D) structure or part of a structure.
The coordinate data may be predicted or real.

label: Structure alignment
definitions: Alignment (superimposition) of molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

A tertiary structure alignment will include the untransformed coordinates of one macromolecule, followed by the second (or subsequent) structure(s) with all the coordinates transformed (by rotation / translation) to give a superposition.

label: Structure alignment report
definitions: An informative report of molecular tertiary structure alignment-derived data.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Structure similarity score
definitions: A value representing molecular structure similarity, measured from structure alignment or some other type of structure comparison.

label: Structural profile
definitions: Some type of structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).

label: Structural (3D) profile alignment
definitions: A 3D profile-3D profile alignment (each profile representing structures or a structure alignment).

label: Protein sequence-structure scoring matrix
definitions: Matrix of values used for scoring sequence-structure compatibility.

label: Sequence-structure alignment
definitions: An alignment of molecular sequence to structure (from threading sequence(s) through 3D structure or representation of structure(s)).

label: Protein report
definitions: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific protein molecules or protein structural domains, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

label: Protein property
definitions: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a protein molecule or model.
The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Protein interaction raw data
definitions: Protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

label: Protein interaction report
definitions: An informative report on interactions (predicted or known) within or between a protein, structural domain or part of a protein. This includes intra- and inter-residue contacts and distances, as well as interactions with other proteins and non-protein entities such as nucleic acid, metal atoms, water, ions etc.

label: Protein family report
definitions: An informative report on a specific protein family or other classification or group of protein sequences or structures.

label: Vmax
definitions: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.

label: Km
definitions: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.

label: Nucleic acid property
definitions: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a nucleic acid molecule.
The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Codon usage data
definitions: Data derived from analysis of codon usage (typically a codon usage table) of DNA sequences.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Gene report
synonyms: Nucleic acid features (gene and transcript structure)
definitions: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.

This includes any report on a particular locus or gene.  This might include the gene name, description, summary and so on. It can include details about the function of a gene, such as its encoded protein or a functional classification of the gene sequence along according to the encoded protein(s).

label: Chromosome report
definitions: An informative report on a specific chromosome.
This includes basic information. e.g. chromosome number, length, karyotype features, chromosome sequence etc.

label: Genotype/phenotype report
definitions: An informative report on the set of genes (or allelic forms) present in an individual, organism or cell and associated with a specific physical characteristic, or a report concerning an organisms traits and phenotypes.

label: Sequence trace
definitions: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.
This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.

label: Sequence assembly
definitions: An assembly of fragments of a (typically genomic) DNA sequence.
Typically, an assembly is a collection of contigs (for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments) that are ordered, aligned and merged. Annotation of the assembled sequence might be included.

label: Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores
definitions: Radiation hybrid scores (RH) scores for one or more markers.
Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores are used in Radiation Hybrid mapping.

label: Genetic linkage report
definitions: An informative report on the linkage of alleles.
This includes linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).

label: Gene expression profile
definitions: Data quantifying the level of expression of (typically) multiple genes, derived for example from microarray experiments.

label: Protein X-ray crystallographic data
definitions: X-ray crystallography data.

label: Protein NMR data
definitions: Protein nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) raw data.

label: Protein circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data
definitions: Protein secondary structure from protein coordinate or circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.

label: Electron microscopy volume map
definitions: Volume map data from electron microscopy.

label: 2D PAGE image
definitions: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis image

label: Mass spectrometry spectra
definitions: Spectra from mass spectrometry.

label: Peptide mass fingerprint
definitions: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.
A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.

label: Peptide identification
definitions: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.

label: Workflow metadata
definitions: Basic information, annotation or documentation concerning a workflow (but not the workflow itself).

label: Mathematical model
definitions: A biological model represented in mathematical terms.

label: Statistical estimate score
definitions: A value representing estimated statistical significance of some observed data; typically sequence database hits.

label: Database cross-mapping
definitions: A mapping of the accession numbers (or other database identifier) of entries between (typically) two biological or biomedical databases.

The cross-mapping is typically a table where each row is an accession number and each column is a database being cross-referenced. The cells give the accession number or identifier of the corresponding entry in a database. If a cell in the table is not filled then no mapping could be found for the database. Additional information might be given on version, date etc.

label: Data index
definitions: An index of data of biological relevance.

label: Data index report
definitions: A report of an analysis of an index of biological data.

label: Database metadata
definitions: Basic information on bioinformatics database(s) or other data sources such as name, type, description, URL etc.

label: Tool metadata
definitions: Basic information about one or more bioinformatics applications or packages, such as name, type, description, or other documentation.

label: User metadata
definitions: Textual metadata on a software author or end-user, for example a person or other software.

label: Small molecule report
definitions: An informative report on a specific chemical compound.

label: Cell line report
definitions: Report on a particular strain of organism cell line including plants, virus, fungi and bacteria. The data typically includes strain number, organism type, growth conditions, source and so on.

label: Ontology term
definitions: A term (name) from an ontology.

label: Ontology concept data
definitions: Data concerning or derived from a concept from a biological ontology.

label: Keyword
definitions: Keyword(s) or phrase(s) used (typically) for text-searching purposes.
Boolean operators (AND, OR and NOT) and wildcard characters may be allowed.

label: Citation
definitions: Bibliographic data that uniquely identifies a scientific article, book or other published material.
A bibliographic reference might include information such as authors, title, journal name, date and (possibly) a link to the abstract or full-text of the article if available.

label: Article
definitions: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.

label: Text mining report
definitions: An abstract of the results of text mining.
A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.

label: Identifier (typed)
definitions: An identifier that identifies a particular type of data.

This concept exists only to assist EDAM maintenance and navigation in graphical browsers.  It does not add semantic information.  This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.

label: Tool identifier
definitions: An identifier of a bioinformatics tool, e.g. an application or web service.

label: Molecule identifier
definitions: Name or other identifier of a molecule.

label: Atom ID
definitions: Identifier (e.g. character symbol) of a specific atom.

label: Molecule name
definitions: Name of a specific molecule.

label: Chromosome name
definitions: Name of a chromosome.

label: Peptide identifier
definitions: Identifier of a peptide chain.

label: Protein identifier
definitions: Identifier of a protein.

label: Compound name
definitions: Unique name of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical registry number
definitions: Unique registry number of a chemical compound.

label: Drug identifier
definitions: Identifier of a drug.

label: Amino acid identifier
definitions: Identifier of an amino acid.

label: Nucleotide identifier
definitions: Name or other identifier of a nucleotide.

label: Monosaccharide identifier
definitions: Identifier of a monosaccharide.

label: Chemical name (ChEBI)
definitions: Unique name from Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI) of a chemical compound.
This is the recommended chemical name for use for example in database annotation.

label: Chemical name (IUPAC)
definitions: IUPAC recommended name of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical name (INN)
definitions: International Non-proprietary Name (INN or 'generic name') of a chemical compound, assigned by the World Health Organisation (WHO).

label: Chemical name (brand)
definitions: Brand name of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical name (synonymous)
definitions: Synonymous name of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical registry number (CAS)
definitions: CAS registry number of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical registry number (Beilstein)
definitions: Beilstein registry number of a chemical compound.

label: Chemical registry number (Gmelin)
definitions: Gmelin registry number of a chemical compound.

label: HET group name
definitions: 3-letter code word for a ligand (HET group) from a PDB file, for example ATP.

label: Amino acid name
definitions: String of one or more ASCII characters representing an amino acid.

label: Nucleotide code
definitions: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a nucleotide.

label: Polypeptide chain ID
definitions: Identifier of a polypeptide chain from a protein.
This is typically a character (for the chain) appended to a PDB identifier, e.g. 1cukA

label: Protein name
definitions: Name of a protein.

label: Enzyme identifier
definitions: Name or other identifier of an enzyme or record from a database of enzymes.

label: EC number
definitions: An Enzyme Commission (EC) number of an enzyme.

label: Enzyme name
definitions: Name of an enzyme.

label: Restriction enzyme name
definitions: Name of a restriction enzyme.

label: Sequence feature ID
definitions: A unique identifier of molecular sequence feature, for example an ID of a feature that is unique within the scope of the GFF file.

label: Sequence position
definitions: A position of one or more points (base or residue) in a sequence, or part of such a specification.

label: Sequence range
definitions: Specification of range(s) of sequence positions.

label: Sequence feature key
definitions: The type of a sequence feature, typically a term or accession from the Sequence Ontology, for example an EMBL or Swiss-Prot sequence feature key.
A feature key indicates the biological nature of the feature or information about changes to or versions of the sequence.

label: Sequence feature qualifier
definitions: Typically one of the EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature qualifiers.
Feature qualifiers hold information about a feature beyond that provided by the feature key and location.

label: Sequence feature label
definitions: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user. Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.
A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.

label: EMBOSS Uniform Feature Object
definitions: The name of a sequence feature-containing entity adhering to the standard feature naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.

label: Gene identifier
definitions: An identifier of a gene, such as a name/symbol or a unique identifier of a gene in a database.

label: Gene symbol
definitions: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.

label: Gene ID (NCBI)
definitions: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.

label: Gene ID (CGD)
definitions: Identifier of a gene or feature from the CGD database.

label: Gene ID (DictyBase)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from DictyBase.

label: Ensembl gene ID
definitions: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.

label: Gene ID (SGD)
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.

label: Gene ID (GeneDB)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from the GeneDB database.

label: TIGR identifier
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the TIGR database.

label: TAIR accession (gene)
definitions: Identifier of an gene from the TAIR database.

label: Protein domain ID
definitions: Identifier of a protein structural domain.
This is typically a character or string concatenated with a PDB identifier and a chain identifier.

label: SCOP domain identifier
definitions: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the SCOP database.

label: CATH domain ID
definitions: Identifier of a protein domain from CATH.

label: SCOP concise classification string (sccs)
definitions: A SCOP concise classification string (sccs) is a compact representation of a SCOP domain classification.
An scss includes the class (alphabetical), fold, superfamily and family (all numerical) to which a given domain belongs.

label: SCOP sunid
definitions: Unique identifier (number) of an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, for example 33229.
A sunid uniquely identifies an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, including leaves (the SCOP domains) and higher level nodes including entries corresponding to the protein level.

label: CATH node ID
definitions: A code number identifying a node from the CATH database.

label: Kingdom name
definitions: The name of a biological kingdom (Bacteria, Archaea, or Eukaryotes).

label: Species name
definitions: The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.

label: Strain name
definitions: The name of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.

label: URI
definitions: A string of characters that name or otherwise identify a resource on the Internet.

label: Database ID
definitions: An identifier of a biological or bioinformatics database.

label: Directory name
definitions: The name of a directory.

label: File name
definitions: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

label: Ontology name
definitions: Name of an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.

label: URL
definitions: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL).

label: URN
definitions: A Uniform Resource Name (URN).

label: LSID
definitions: A Life Science Identifier (LSID) - a unique identifier of some data.
LSIDs provide a standard way to locate and describe data. An LSID is represented as a Uniform Resource Name (URN) with the following format: URN:LSID:<Authority>:<Namespace>:<ObjectID>[:<Version>]

label: Database name
definitions: The name of a biological or bioinformatics database.

label: Enumerated file name
definitions: The name of a file (of any type) with restricted possible values.

label: File name extension
definitions: The extension of a file name.
A file extension is the characters appearing after the final '.' in the file name.

label: File base name
definitions: The base name of a file.
A file base name is the file name stripped of its directory specification and extension.

label: QSAR descriptor name
definitions: Name of a QSAR descriptor.

label: Sequence identifier
definitions: An identifier of molecular sequence(s) or entries from a molecular sequence database.

label: Sequence set ID
definitions: An identifier of a set of molecular sequence(s).

label: Sequence alignment ID
definitions: Identifier of a molecular sequence alignment, for example a record from an alignment database.

label: Phylogenetic tree ID
definitions: Identifier of a phylogenetic tree for example from a phylogenetic tree database.

label: Comparison matrix identifier
definitions: An identifier of a comparison matrix.

label: Structure ID
definitions: A unique and persistent identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.

label: Structural (3D) profile ID
definitions: Identifier or name of a structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).

label: Structure alignment ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of tertiary structure alignments.

label: Amino acid index ID
definitions: Identifier of an index of amino acid physicochemical and biochemical property data.

label: Protein interaction ID
definitions: Identifier of a report of protein interactions from a protein interaction database (typically).

label: Protein family identifier
definitions: Identifier of a protein family.

label: Codon usage table name
definitions: Unique name of a codon usage table.

label: Transcription factor identifier
definitions: Identifier of a transcription factor (or a TF binding site).

label: Experiment annotation ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of microarray data.

label: Electron microscopy model ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of electron microscopy data.

label: Gene expression report ID
definitions: Accession of a report of gene expression (e.g. a gene expression profile) from a database.

label: Genotype and phenotype annotation ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotypes and phenotypes.

label: Pathway or network identifier
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of biological pathways or networks.

label: Workflow ID
definitions: Identifier of a biological or biomedical workflow, typically from a database of workflows.

label: Data resource definition ID
definitions: Identifier of a data type definition from some provider.

label: Biological model ID
definitions: Identifier of a mathematical model, typically an entry from a database.

label: Compound identifier
definitions: Identifier of an entry from a database of chemicals.

label: Ontology concept ID
definitions: A unique (typically numerical) identifier of a concept in an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.

label: Article ID
definitions: Unique identifier of a scientific article.

label: FlyBase ID
definitions: Identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.

label: WormBase name
definitions: Name of an object from the WormBase database, usually a human-readable name.

label: WormBase class
definitions: Class of an object from the WormBase database.
A WormBase class describes the type of object such as 'sequence' or 'protein'.

label: Sequence accession
definitions: A persistent, unique identifier of a molecular sequence database entry.

label: EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Address
definitions: The name of a sequence-based entity adhering to the standard sequence naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.

label: Sequence accession (protein)
definitions: Accession number of a protein sequence database entry.

label: Sequence accession (nucleic acid)
definitions: Accession number of a nucleotide sequence database entry.

label: RefSeq accession
definitions: Accession number of a RefSeq database entry.

label: PIR identifier
definitions: An identifier of PIR sequence database entry.

label: Gramene primary identifier
definitions: Primary identifier of a Gramene database entry.

label: EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ ID
definitions: Identifier of a (nucleic acid) entry from the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.

label: Sequence cluster ID (UniGene)
definitions: A unique identifier of an entry (gene cluster) from the NCBI UniGene database.

label: dbEST accession
definitions: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.

label: dbSNP ID
definitions: Identifier of a dbSNP database entry.

label: Sequence cluster ID
definitions: An identifier of a cluster of molecular sequence(s).

label: Sequence cluster ID (COG)
definitions: Unique identifier of an entry from the COG database.

label: Sequence motif identifier
definitions: Identifier of a sequence motif, for example an entry from a motif database.

label: Sequence profile ID
definitions: Identifier of a sequence profile.
A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment.

label: ELM ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the ELMdb database of protein functional sites.

label: Prosite accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the Prosite database.

label: HMMER hidden Markov model ID
definitions: Unique identifier or name of a HMMER hidden Markov model.

label: JASPAR profile ID
definitions: Unique identifier or name of a profile from the JASPAR database.

label: TreeBASE study accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the TreeBASE database.

label: TreeFam accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the TreeFam database.

label: Comparison matrix name
definitions: Unique name or identifier of a comparison matrix.
See for example http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/help/matrix.

label: PDB ID
definitions: An identifier of an entry from the PDB database.

A PDB identification code which consists of 4 characters, the first of which is a digit in the range 0 - 9; the remaining 3 are alpha-numeric, and letters are upper case only. (source: https://cdn.rcsb.org/wwpdb/docs/documentation/file-format/PDB_format_1996.pdf)

label: AAindex ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.

label: BIND accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the BIND database.

label: IntAct accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the IntAct database.

label: Protein family name
definitions: Name of a protein family.

label: InterPro entry name
definitions: Name of an InterPro entry, usually indicating the type of protein matches for that entry.

label: InterPro accession
definitions: Primary accession number of an InterPro entry.
Every InterPro entry has a unique accession number to provide a persistent citation of database records.

label: InterPro secondary accession
definitions: Secondary accession number of an InterPro entry.

label: Gene3D ID
definitions: Unique identifier of an entry from the Gene3D database.

label: PIRSF ID
definitions: Unique identifier of an entry from the PIRSF database.

label: PRINTS code
definitions: The unique identifier of an entry in the PRINTS database.

label: Pfam accession number
definitions: Accession number of a Pfam entry.

label: SMART accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the SMART database.

label: Superfamily hidden Markov model number
definitions: Unique identifier (number) of a hidden Markov model from the Superfamily database.

label: TIGRFam ID
definitions: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.

label: ProDom accession number
definitions: A ProDom domain family accession number.
ProDom is a protein domain family database.

label: TRANSFAC accession number
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the TRANSFAC database.

label: ArrayExpress accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the ArrayExpress database.

label: PRIDE experiment accession number
definitions: PRIDE experiment accession number.

label: EMDB ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the EMDB electron microscopy database.

label: GEO accession number
definitions: Accession number of an entry from the GEO database.

label: GermOnline ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the GermOnline database.

label: EMAGE ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the EMAGE database.

label: Disease ID
definitions: Accession number of an entry from a database of disease.

label: HGVbase ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the HGVbase database.

label: OMIM ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the OMIM database.

label: KEGG object identifier
definitions: Unique identifier of an object from one of the KEGG databases (excluding the GENES division).

label: Pathway ID (reactome)
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the Reactome database.

label: Pathway ID (BioCyc)
definitions: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.

label: Pathway ID (INOH)
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the INOH database.

label: Pathway ID (PATIKA)
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the PATIKA database.

label: Pathway ID (CPDB)
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the CPDB (ConsensusPathDB) biological pathways database, which is an identifier from an external database integrated into CPDB.
This concept refers to identifiers used by the databases collated in CPDB; CPDB identifiers are not independently defined.

label: Pathway ID (Panther)
definitions: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Panther Pathways database.

label: MIRIAM identifier
definitions: Unique identifier of a MIRIAM data resource.
This is the identifier used internally by MIRIAM for a data type.

label: MIRIAM data type name
definitions: The name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.

label: MIRIAM URI
definitions: The URI (URL or URN) of a data entity from the MIRIAM database.

A MIRIAM URI consists of the URI of the MIRIAM data type (PubMed, UniProt etc) followed by the identifier of an element of that data type, for example PMID for a publication or an accession number for a GO term.

label: MIRIAM data type primary name
definitions: The primary name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
The primary name of a MIRIAM data type is taken from a controlled vocabulary.

label: MIRIAM data type synonymous name
definitions: A synonymous name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
A synonymous name for a MIRIAM data type taken from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Taverna workflow ID
definitions: Unique identifier of a Taverna workflow.

label: Biological model name
definitions: Name of a biological (mathematical) model.

label: BioModel ID
definitions: Unique identifier of an entry from the BioModel database.

label: PubChem CID
definitions: Chemical structure specified in PubChem Compound Identification (CID), a non-zero integer identifier for a unique chemical structure.

label: ChemSpider ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the ChemSpider database.

label: ChEBI ID
definitions: Identifier of an entry from the ChEBI database.

label: BioPax concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the BioPax ontology.

label: GO concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from The Gene Ontology.

label: MeSH concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the MeSH vocabulary.

label: HGNC concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.

label: NCBI taxonomy ID
definitions: A stable unique identifier for each taxon (for a species, a family, an order, or any other group in the NCBI taxonomy database.

label: Plant Ontology concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the Plant Ontology (PO).

label: UMLS concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the UMLS vocabulary.

label: FMA concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from Foundational Model of Anatomy.

Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.

label: EMAP concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the EMAP mouse ontology.

label: ChEBI concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the ChEBI ontology.

label: MGED concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the MGED ontology.

label: myGrid concept ID
definitions: An identifier of a concept from the myGrid ontology.

The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.

label: PubMed ID
definitions: PubMed unique identifier of an article.

label: DOI
definitions: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a published article.

label: Medline UI
definitions: Medline UI (unique identifier) of an article.
The use of Medline UI has been replaced by the PubMed unique identifier.

label: Tool name
definitions: The name of a computer package, application, method or function.

label: Tool name (signature)
definitions: The unique name of a signature (sequence classifier) method.
Signature methods from http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/InterProScan/help.html#results include BlastProDom, FPrintScan, HMMPIR, HMMPfam, HMMSmart, HMMTigr, ProfileScan, ScanRegExp, SuperFamily and HAMAP.

label: Tool name (BLAST)
definitions: The name of a BLAST tool.
This include 'blastn', 'blastp', 'blastx', 'tblastn' and 'tblastx'.

label: Tool name (FASTA)
definitions: The name of a FASTA tool.
This includes 'fasta3', 'fastx3', 'fasty3', 'fastf3', 'fasts3' and 'ssearch'.

label: Tool name (EMBOSS)
definitions: The name of an EMBOSS application.

label: Tool name (EMBASSY package)
definitions: The name of an EMBASSY package.

label: QSAR descriptor (constitutional)
definitions: A QSAR constitutional descriptor.

label: QSAR descriptor (electronic)
definitions: A QSAR electronic descriptor.

label: QSAR descriptor (geometrical)
definitions: A QSAR geometrical descriptor.

label: QSAR descriptor (topological)
definitions: A QSAR topological descriptor.

label: QSAR descriptor (molecular)
definitions: A QSAR molecular descriptor.

label: Sequence set (protein)
definitions: Any collection of multiple protein sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.

label: Sequence set (nucleic acid)
definitions: Any collection of multiple nucleotide sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.

label: Sequence cluster
definitions: A set of sequences that have been clustered or otherwise classified as belonging to a group including (typically) sequence cluster information.
The cluster might include sequences identifiers, short descriptions, alignment and summary information.

label: Proteolytic digest
definitions: A protein sequence cleaved into peptide fragments (by enzymatic or chemical cleavage) with fragment masses.

label: Restriction digest
definitions: Restriction digest fragments from digesting a nucleotide sequence with restriction sites using a restriction endonuclease.

label: PCR primers
definitions: Oligonucleotide primer(s) for PCR and DNA amplification, for example a minimal primer set.

label: Sequence cluster (protein)
definitions: A cluster of protein sequences.
The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.

label: Sequence cluster (nucleic acid)
definitions: A cluster of nucleotide sequences.
The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.

label: Sequence length
definitions: The size (length) of a sequence, subsequence or region in a sequence, or range(s) of lengths.

label: Sequence property
definitions: An informative report about non-positional sequence features, typically a report on general molecular sequence properties derived from sequence analysis.

label: Sequence features
definitions: Annotation of positional features of molecular sequence(s), i.e. that can be mapped to position(s) in the sequence.

This includes annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table, or any other report of sequence features.  General feature reports are a source of sequence feature table information although internal conversion would be required.

label: Sequence complexity report
definitions: A report on sequence complexity, for example low-complexity or repeat regions in sequences.

label: Sequence ambiguity report
definitions: A report on ambiguity in molecular sequence(s).

label: Sequence composition report
definitions: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence(s).

label: Peptide molecular weight hits
definitions: A report on peptide fragments of certain molecular weight(s) in one or more protein sequences.

label: Base position variability plot
definitions: A plot of third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.

label: Base frequencies table
definitions: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.

label: Base word frequencies table
definitions: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.

label: Amino acid frequencies table
definitions: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.

label: Amino acid word frequencies table
definitions: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.

label: Feature table
definitions: Annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table.

label: Map
definitions: A map of (typically one) DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features.

label: Nucleic acid features
definitions: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a nucleotide sequence.
This includes nucleotide sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of nucleic acid features.

label: Protein features
definitions: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.
This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.

label: Genetic map
definitions: A map showing the relative positions of genetic markers in a nucleic acid sequence, based on estimation of non-physical distance such as recombination frequencies.

A genetic (linkage) map indicates the proximity of two genes on a chromosome, whether two genes are linked and the frequency they are transmitted together to an offspring. They are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.

label: Sequence map
definitions: A map of genetic markers in a contiguous, assembled genomic sequence, with the sizes and separation of markers measured in base pairs.

A sequence map typically includes annotation on significant subsequences such as contigs, haplotypes and genes. The contigs shown will (typically) be a set of small overlapping clones representing a complete chromosomal segment.

label: Physical map
definitions: A map of DNA (linear or circular) annotated with physical features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes or genetic markers, along with the physical distances between them.
Distance in a physical map is measured in base pairs. A physical map might be ordered relative to a reference map (typically a genetic map) in the process of genome sequencing.

label: Cytogenetic map
definitions: A map showing banding patterns derived from direct observation of a stained chromosome.

This is the lowest-resolution physical map and can provide only rough estimates of physical (base pair) distances.  Like a genetic map, they are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.

label: DNA transduction map
definitions: A gene map showing distances between loci based on relative cotransduction frequencies.

label: Gene map
definitions: Sequence map of a single gene annotated with genetic features such as introns, exons, untranslated regions, polyA signals, promoters, enhancers and (possibly) mutations defining alleles of a gene.

label: Plasmid map
definitions: Sequence map of a plasmid (circular DNA).

label: Genome map
definitions: Sequence map of a whole genome.

label: Restriction map
definitions: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

label: Dirichlet distribution
definitions: Dirichlet distribution used by hidden Markov model analysis programs.

label: Regular expression
definitions: Regular expression pattern.

label: Sequence motif
definitions: Any specific or conserved pattern (typically expressed as a regular expression) in a molecular sequence.

label: Sequence profile
definitions: Some type of statistical model representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.

label: Protein signature
definitions: An informative report about a specific or conserved protein sequence pattern.

label: Position frequency matrix
definitions: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.

label: Position weight matrix
definitions: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).

label: Information content matrix
definitions: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.

label: Hidden Markov model
definitions: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.  For example, a hidden Markov model representation of a set or alignment of sequences.

label: Fingerprint
definitions: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.

label: Sequence alignment (pair)
definitions: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences.

label: Sequence alignment (nucleic acid)
definitions: Alignment of multiple nucleotide sequences.

label: Sequence alignment (protein)
definitions: Alignment of multiple protein sequences.

label: Sequence alignment (hybrid)
definitions: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences of different types.
Hybrid sequence alignments include for example genomic DNA to EST, cDNA or mRNA.

label: Alignment score or penalty
definitions: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening or extending a gap in an alignment.

label: Gap opening penalty
definitions: A penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.

label: Gap extension penalty
definitions: A penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.

label: Gap separation penalty
definitions: A penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.

label: Match reward score
definitions: The score for a 'match' used in various sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.

label: Mismatch penalty score
definitions: The score (penalty) for a 'mismatch' used in various alignment and sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.

label: Drop off score
definitions: This is the threshold drop in score at which extension of word alignment is halted.

label: Terminal gap opening penalty
definitions: A number defining the penalty for opening gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.

label: Terminal gap extension penalty
definitions: A number defining the penalty for extending gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.

label: Sequence identity
definitions: Sequence identity is the number (%) of matches (identical characters) in positions from an alignment of two molecular sequences.

label: Sequence similarity
definitions: Sequence similarity is the similarity (expressed as a percentage) of two molecular sequences calculated from their alignment, a scoring matrix for scoring characters substitutions and penalties for gap insertion and extension.
Data Type is float probably.

label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative data
definitions: Continuous quantitative data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

label: Phylogenetic discrete data
definitions: Character data with discrete states that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

label: Phylogenetic character cliques
definitions: One or more cliques of mutually compatible characters that are generated, for example from analysis of discrete character data, and are used to generate a phylogeny.

label: Phylogenetic invariants
definitions: Phylogenetic invariants data for testing alternative tree topologies.

label: DNA substitution model
definitions: A model of DNA substitution that explains a DNA sequence alignment, derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.

label: Phylogenetic tree distances
definitions: Distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees.

label: Phylogenetic character contrasts
definitions: Independent contrasts for characters used in a phylogenetic tree, or covariances, regressions and correlations between characters for those contrasts.

label: Comparison matrix (nucleotide)
definitions: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.

label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)
definitions: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.

label: Nucleic acid structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structure.

label: Protein structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure.

label: Protein-ligand complex
definitions: The structure of a protein in complex with a ligand, typically a small molecule such as an enzyme substrate or cofactor, but possibly another macromolecule.

This includes interactions of proteins with atoms, ions and small molecules or macromolecules such as nucleic acids or other polypeptides.  For stable inter-polypeptide interactions use 'Protein complex' instead.

label: Carbohydrate structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a carbohydrate (3D) structure.

label: Small molecule structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a small molecule, such as any common chemical compound.

label: DNA structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a DNA tertiary (3D) structure.

label: RNA structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for an RNA tertiary (3D) structure.

label: tRNA structure
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a tRNA tertiary (3D) structure, including tmRNA, snoRNAs etc.

label: Protein chain
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a polypeptide chain.

label: Protein domain
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a protein domain.

label: C-alpha trace
definitions: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.

label: Structure alignment (pair)
definitions: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Structure alignment (protein)
definitions: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Structure alignment (nucleic acid)
definitions: Alignment (superimposition) of nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Structure alignment (RNA)
definitions: Alignment (superimposition) of RNA tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Structural transformation matrix
definitions: Matrix to transform (rotate/translate) 3D coordinates, typically the transformation necessary to superimpose two molecular structures.

label: Root-mean-square deviation
definitions: Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) is calculated to measure the average distance between superimposed macromolecular coordinates.

label: Tanimoto similarity score
definitions: A measure of the similarity between two ligand fingerprints.

A ligand fingerprint is derived from ligand structural data from a Protein DataBank file. It reflects the elements or groups present or absent, covalent bonds and bond orders and the bonded environment in terms of SATIS codes and BLEEP atom types.

label: 3D-1D scoring matrix
definitions: A matrix of 3D-1D scores reflecting the probability of amino acids to occur in different tertiary structural environments.

label: Amino acid index
definitions: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.

label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)
definitions: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.

label: Amino acid pair-wise contact potentials
definitions: Statistical protein contact potentials.

label: Amino acid index (molecular weight)
definitions: Molecular weights of amino acids.

label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)
definitions: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.

label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)
definitions: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.

label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)
definitions: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.

label: Peptide molecular weights
definitions: List of molecular weight(s) of one or more proteins or peptides, for example cut by proteolytic enzymes or reagents.
The report might include associated data such as frequency of peptide fragment molecular weights.

label: Peptide hydrophobic moment
definitions: Report on the hydrophobic moment of a polypeptide sequence.
Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

label: Protein aliphatic index
definitions: The aliphatic index of a protein.
The aliphatic index is the relative protein volume occupied by aliphatic side chains.

label: Protein sequence hydropathy plot
definitions: A protein sequence with annotation on hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions, hydrophobicity plot etc.
Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

label: Protein charge plot
definitions: A plot of the mean charge of the amino acids within a window of specified length as the window is moved along a protein sequence.

label: Protein solubility
definitions: The solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence or structure.

label: Protein crystallizability
definitions: Data on the crystallizability of a protein sequence.

label: Protein globularity
definitions: Data on the stability, intrinsic disorder or globularity of a protein sequence.

label: Protein titration curve
definitions: The titration curve of a protein.

label: Protein isoelectric point
definitions: The isoelectric point of one proteins.

label: Protein pKa value
definitions: The pKa value of a protein.

label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate
definitions: The hydrogen exchange rate of a protein.

label: Protein extinction coefficient
definitions: The extinction coefficient of a protein.

label: Protein optical density
definitions: The optical density of a protein.

label: Peptide immunogenicity data
definitions: An report on allergenicity / immunogenicity of peptides and proteins.

This includes data on peptide ligands that elicit an immune response (immunogens), allergic cross-reactivity, predicted antigenicity (Hopp and Woods plot) etc. These data are useful in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.

label: Protein structure report
definitions: Annotation about, or structural information derived from, one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.

This includes for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).

label: Protein structural quality report
definitions: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.
Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.

label: Protein solvent accessibility report
definitions: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.

This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.

label: Ramachandran plot
definitions: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

label: Protein dipole moment
definitions: Data on the net charge distribution (dipole moment) of a protein structure.

label: Protein distance matrix
definitions: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

label: Protein contact map
definitions: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.

label: Protein residue 3D cluster
definitions: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.

label: Protein hydrogen bonds
definitions: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.

label: Protein-ligand interaction report
definitions: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).

label: Nucleic acid melting profile
definitions: Data on the dissociation characteristics of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or a DNA/RNA hybrid) during heating.
A melting (stability) profile calculated the free energy required to unwind and separate the nucleic acid strands, plotted for sliding windows over a sequence.

label: Nucleic acid enthalpy
definitions: Enthalpy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

label: Nucleic acid entropy
definitions: Entropy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

label: Nucleic acid stitch profile
definitions: Stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

A stitch profile diagram shows partly melted DNA conformations (with probabilities) at a range of temperatures. For example, a stitch profile might show possible loop openings with their location, size, probability and fluctuations at a given temperature.

label: DNA base pair stacking energies data
definitions: DNA base pair stacking energies data.

label: DNA base pair twist angle data
definitions: DNA base pair twist angle data.

label: DNA base trimer roll angles data
definitions: DNA base trimer roll angles data.

label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot
definitions: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.
Such as generated by the Vienna package.

label: Nucleic acid folding report
definitions: A report on an analysis of RNA/DNA folding, minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences, energy landscape of RNA mutants etc.

label: Codon usage table
definitions: Table of codon usage data calculated from one or more nucleic acid sequences.

A codon usage table might include the codon usage table name, optional comments and a table with columns for codons and corresponding codon usage data. A genetic code can be extracted from or represented by a codon usage table.

label: Genetic code
definitions: A genetic code for an organism.
A genetic code need not include detailed codon usage information.

label: Codon usage bias plot
definitions: A plot of the synonymous codon usage calculated for windows over a nucleotide sequence.

label: Codon usage fraction difference
definitions: The differences in codon usage fractions between two codon usage tables.

label: Pharmacogenomic test report
definitions: Data on the influence of genotype on drug response.
The report might correlate gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.

label: Disease report
definitions: An informative report on a specific disease.
For example, an informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.

label: Heat map
definitions: A graphical 2D tabular representation of gene expression data, typically derived from a DNA microarray experiment.
A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different genes and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell color represents the level of expression of a gene that context.

label: Drug structure relationship map
definitions: A report typically including a map (diagram) of drug structure relationships.

label: E-value
definitions: A simple floating point number defining the lower or upper limit of an expectation value (E-value).

An expectation value (E-Value) is the expected number of observations which are at least as extreme as observations expected to occur by random chance. The E-value describes the number of hits with a given score or better that are expected to occur at random when searching a database of a particular size. It decreases exponentially with the score (S) of a hit. A low E value indicates a more significant score.

label: Z-value
definitions: The z-value is the number of standard deviations a data value is above or below a mean value.
A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.

label: P-value
definitions: The P-value is the probability of obtaining by random chance a result that is at least as extreme as an observed result, assuming a NULL hypothesis is true.
A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.

label: Username
definitions: A username on a computer system.

label: Password
definitions: A password on a computer system.

label: Email address
definitions: A valid email address of an end-user.

label: Person name
definitions: The name of a person.

label: Drug report
definitions: An informative report on a specific drug.

label: Phylogenetic tree image
definitions: An image (for viewing or printing) of a phylogenetic tree including (typically) a plot of rooted or unrooted phylogenies, cladograms, circular trees or phenograms and associated information.
See also 'Phylogenetic tree'

label: RNA secondary structure image
definitions: Image of RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.

label: Protein secondary structure image
definitions: Image of protein secondary structure.

label: Structure image
definitions: Image of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Sequence alignment image
definitions: Image of two or more aligned molecular sequences possibly annotated with alignment features.

label: Chemical structure image
definitions: An image of the structure of a small chemical compound.
The molecular identifier and formula are typically included.

label: Fate map
definitions: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.

label: Microarray spots image
definitions: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.

label: Ontology concept definition
definitions: The definition of a concept from an ontology.

label: PDB residue number
definitions: A residue identifier (a string) from a PDB file.

label: Atomic coordinate
definitions: Cartesian coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

label: Atomic x coordinate
definitions: Cartesian x coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

label: Atomic y coordinate
definitions: Cartesian y coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

label: Atomic z coordinate
definitions: Cartesian z coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

label: PDB atom name
definitions: Identifier (a string) of a specific atom from a PDB file for a molecular structure.

label: Protein atom
definitions: Data on a single atom from a protein structure.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

label: Protein residue
definitions: Data on a single amino acid residue position in a protein structure.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

label: Atom name
definitions: Name of an atom.

label: PDB residue name
definitions: Three-letter amino acid residue names as used in PDB files.

label: PDB model number
definitions: Identifier of a model structure from a PDB file.

label: Sequence version
definitions: Information on an molecular sequence version.

label: Score
definitions: A numerical value, that is some type of scored value arising for example from a prediction method.

label: Gene ID (PlasmoDB)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from PlasmoDB Plasmodium Genome Resource.

label: Gene ID (EcoGene)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from EcoGene Database.

label: Gene ID (FlyBase)
definitions: Gene identifier from FlyBase database.

label: Gene ID (Gramene)
definitions: Gene identifier from Gramene database.

label: Gene ID (Virginia microbial)
definitions: Gene identifier from Virginia Bioinformatics Institute microbial database.

label: Gene ID (SGN)
definitions: Gene identifier from Sol Genomics Network.

label: Gene ID (WormBase)
definitions: Gene identifier used by WormBase database.

label: ORF name
definitions: The name of an open reading frame attributed by a sequencing project.

label: Clone ID
definitions: An identifier of a clone (cloned molecular sequence) from a database.

label: PDB insertion code
definitions: An insertion code (part of the residue number) for an amino acid residue from a PDB file.

label: Atomic occupancy
definitions: The fraction of an atom type present at a site in a molecular structure.
The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at a site should not normally significantly exceed 1.0.

label: Isotropic B factor
definitions: Isotropic B factor (atomic displacement parameter) for an atom from a PDB file.

label: Deletion map
definitions: A cytogenetic map showing chromosome banding patterns in mutant cell lines relative to the wild type.

A cytogenetic map is built from a set of mutant cell lines with sub-chromosomal deletions and a reference wild-type line ('genome deletion panel'). The panel is used to map markers onto the genome by comparing mutant to wild-type banding patterns. Markers are linked (occur in the same deleted region) if they share the same banding pattern (presence or absence) as the deletion panel.

label: QTL map
definitions: A genetic map which shows the approximate location of quantitative trait loci (QTL) between two or more markers.

label: Haplotype map
definitions: A map of haplotypes in a genome or other sequence, describing common patterns of genetic variation.

label: Map set data
definitions: Data describing a set of multiple genetic or physical maps, typically sharing a common set of features which are mapped.

label: Protein fold name
definitions: The name of a protein fold.

label: Taxon
definitions: The name of a group of organisms belonging to the same taxonomic rank.
For a complete list of taxonomic ranks see https://www.phenoscape.org/wiki/Taxonomic_Rank_Vocabulary.

label: Organism identifier
definitions: A unique identifier of a (group of) organisms.

label: Genus name
definitions: The name of a genus of organism.

label: Taxonomic classification
definitions: The full name for a group of organisms, reflecting their biological classification and (usually) conforming to a standard nomenclature.
Name components correspond to levels in a taxonomic hierarchy (e.g. 'Genus', 'Species', etc.) Meta information such as a reference where the name was defined and a date might be included.

label: iHOP organism ID
definitions: A unique identifier for an organism used in the iHOP database.

label: Genbank common name
definitions: Common name for an organism as used in the GenBank database.

label: NCBI taxon
definitions: The name of a taxon from the NCBI taxonomy database.

label: Author ID
definitions: Information on the authors of a published work.

label: DragonDB author identifier
definitions: An identifier representing an author in the DragonDB database.

label: Annotated URI
definitions: A URI along with annotation describing the data found at the address.

label: Gene ID (GeneFarm)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from the GeneFarm database.

label: Blattner number
definitions: The blattner identifier for a gene.

label: iHOP symbol
definitions: A unique identifier of a protein or gene used in the iHOP database.

label: Locus ID
definitions: A unique name or other identifier of a genetic locus, typically conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.

label: Locus ID (AGI)
definitions: Locus identifier for Arabidopsis Genome Initiative (TAIR, TIGR and MIPS databases)

label: Locus ID (ASPGD)
definitions: Identifier for loci from ASPGD (Aspergillus Genome Database).

label: Locus ID (MGG)
definitions: Identifier for loci from Magnaporthe grisea Database at the Broad Institute.

label: Locus ID (CGD)
definitions: Identifier for loci from CGD (Candida Genome Database).

label: Locus ID (CMR)
definitions: Locus identifier for Comprehensive Microbial Resource at the J. Craig Venter Institute.

label: NCBI locus tag
definitions: Identifier for loci from NCBI database.

label: Locus ID (SGD)
definitions: Identifier for loci from SGD (Saccharomyces Genome Database).

label: Locus ID (MMP)
definitions: Identifier of loci from Maize Mapping Project.

label: Locus ID (DictyBase)
definitions: Identifier of locus from DictyBase (Dictyostelium discoideum).

label: Locus ID (EntrezGene)
definitions: Identifier of a locus from EntrezGene database.

label: Locus ID (MaizeGDB)
definitions: Identifier of locus from MaizeGDB (Maize genome database).

label: Gene ID (KOME)
definitions: Identifier of a gene from the KOME database.

label: Locus ID (Tropgene)
definitions: Identifier of a locus from the Tropgene database.

label: Alignment
definitions: An alignment of molecular sequences, structures or profiles derived from them.

label: Atomic property
definitions: Data for an atom (in a molecular structure).

label: UniProt keyword
definitions: A word or phrase that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.

label: Sequence coordinates
definitions: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.

This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.

label: Amino acid property
definitions: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all amino acids.

label: Map data
definitions: A molecular map (genetic or physical), an attribute of such a map, or data extracted from or derived from the analysis of such a map.

This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. It includes concepts that are best described as scientific text or closely concerned with or derived from text.

label: Enzyme kinetics data
definitions: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Michaelis Menten plot
definitions: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.

label: Hanes Woolf plot
definitions: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).

label: Evidence
definitions: Typically a statement about some data or results, including evidence or the source of a statement, which may include computational prediction, laboratory experiment, literature reference etc.

label: Sequence
definitions: One or more molecular sequences, possibly with associated annotation.

This concept is a placeholder of concepts for primary sequence data including raw sequences and sequence records.  It should not normally be used for derivatives such as sequence alignments, motifs or profiles.

label: Report
definitions: A human-readable collection of information including annotation on a biological entity or phenomena, computer-generated reports of analysis of primary data (e.g. sequence or structural), and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.

You can use this term by default for any textual report, in case you can't find another, more specific term. Reports may be generated automatically or collated by hand and can include metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.

label: Molecular property (general)
definitions: General data for a molecule.

label: Sequence motif (nucleic acid)
definitions: A nucleotide sequence motif.

label: Sequence motif (protein)
definitions: An amino acid sequence motif.

label: Database search results
definitions: A report of hits from searching a database of some type.

label: Matrix
definitions: An array of numerical values.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

label: Nucleic acid report
definitions: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific nucleic acid molecules, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

label: Structure report
definitions: An informative report on general information, properties or features of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

label: Nucleic acid structure data
definitions: A report on nucleic acid structure-derived data, describing structural properties of a DNA molecule, or any other annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s).
This includes reports on the stiffness, curvature, twist/roll data or other conformational parameters or properties.

label: Molecular property
definitions: A report on the physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of molecules, or parts of a molecule.

label: DNA base structural data
definitions: Structural data for DNA base pairs or runs of bases, such as energy or angle data.

label: Accession
definitions: A persistent (stable) and unique identifier, typically identifying an object (entry) from a database.

label: Data reference
definitions: Reference to a dataset (or a cross-reference between two datasets), typically one or more entries in a biological database or ontology.
A list of database accessions or identifiers are usually included.

label: Job identifier
definitions: An identifier of a submitted job.

label: Name
definitions: A name of a thing, which need not necessarily uniquely identify it.

label: User ID
definitions: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).

label: KEGG organism code
definitions: A three-letter code used in the KEGG databases to uniquely identify organisms.

label: BioCyc ID
definitions: Identifier of an object from one of the BioCyc databases.

label: Compound ID (BioCyc)
definitions: Identifier of a compound from the BioCyc chemical compounds database.

label: Reaction ID (BioCyc)
definitions: Identifier of a biological reaction from the BioCyc reactions database.

label: Enzyme ID (BioCyc)
definitions: Identifier of an enzyme from the BioCyc enzymes database.

label: Reaction ID
definitions: Identifier of a biological reaction from a database.

label: Identifier (hybrid)
definitions: An identifier that is re-used for data objects of fundamentally different types (typically served from a single database).
This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.

label: Molecular property identifier
definitions: Identifier of a molecular property.

label: Codon usage table ID
definitions: Identifier of a codon usage table, for example a genetic code.

label: FlyBase primary identifier
definitions: Primary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.

label: WormBase identifier
definitions: Identifier of an object from the WormBase database.

label: WormBase wormpep ID
definitions: Protein identifier used by WormBase database.

label: Map identifier
definitions: An identifier of a map of a molecular sequence.

label: Person identifier
definitions: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).

label: Nucleic acid identifier
definitions: Name or other identifier of a nucleic acid molecule.

label: Genetic code identifier
definitions: An identifier of a genetic code.

label: Genetic code name
definitions: Informal name for a genetic code, typically an organism name.

label: File format name
definitions: Name of a file format such as HTML, PNG, PDF, EMBL, GenBank and so on.

label: Operating system name
definitions: Name of a computer operating system such as Linux, PC or Mac.

label: Logical operator
definitions: A logical operator such as OR, AND, XOR, and NOT.

label: Gap penalty
definitions: A penalty for introducing or extending a gap in an alignment.

label: Nucleic acid melting temperature
definitions: A temperature concerning nucleic acid denaturation, typically the temperature at which the two strands of a hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA) molecule separate.

label: Concentration
definitions: The concentration of a chemical compound.

label: Sequence name
definitions: Any arbitrary name of a molecular sequence.

label: Fickett testcode plot
definitions: A plot of Fickett testcode statistic (identifying protein coding regions) in a nucleotide sequences.

label: Sequence similarity plot
