label: T-Coffee format
definitions: T-Coffee program alignment format.

label: TreeCon-seq
definitions: Treecon format for (aligned) sequences.

label: Phylogenetic tree format
definitions: Data format for a phylogenetic tree.

label: Biological pathway or network format
definitions: Data format for a biological pathway or network.

label: Sequence-profile alignment format
definitions: Data format for a sequence-profile alignment.

label: Amino acid index format
definitions: Data format for an amino acid index.

label: Article format
definitions: Data format for a full-text scientific article.

label: Text mining report format
definitions: Data format of a report from text mining.

label: Enzyme kinetics report format
definitions: Data format for reports on enzyme kinetics.

label: Chemical data format
definitions: Format of a report on a chemical compound.

label: Gene annotation format
definitions: Format of a report on a particular locus, gene, gene system or groups of genes.

label: Workflow format
definitions: Format of a workflow.

label: Tertiary structure format
definitions: Data format for a molecular tertiary structure.

label: Chemical formula format
definitions: Text format of a chemical formula.

label: Phylogenetic character data format
definitions: Format of raw (unplotted) phylogenetic data.

label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative character format
definitions: Format of phylogenetic continuous quantitative character data.

label: Phylogenetic discrete states format
definitions: Format of phylogenetic discrete states data.

label: Phylogenetic tree report (cliques) format
definitions: Format of phylogenetic cliques data.

label: Phylogenetic tree report (invariants) format
definitions: Format of phylogenetic invariants data.

label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree distances) format
definitions: Format for phylogenetic tree distance data.

label: Protein family report format
definitions: Format for reports on a protein family.

label: Protein interaction format
definitions: Format for molecular interaction data.

label: Sequence assembly format
definitions: Format for sequence assembly data.

label: Microarray experiment data format
definitions: Format for information about a microarray experimental per se (not the data generated from that experiment).

label: Sequence trace format
definitions: Format for sequence trace data (i.e. including base call information).

label: Gene expression report format
definitions: Format of a file of gene expression data, e.g. a gene expression matrix or profile.

label: Map format
definitions: Format of a map of (typically one) molecular sequence annotated with features.

label: Nucleic acid features (primers) format
definitions: Format of a report on PCR primers or hybridisation oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

label: Protein report format
definitions: Format of a report of general information about a specific protein.

label: 3D-1D scoring matrix format
definitions: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores (amino acid environment probabilities).

label: Protein structure report (quality evaluation) format
definitions: Format of a report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.

label: Database hits (sequence) format
definitions: Format of a report on sequence hits and associated data from searching a sequence database.

label: Sequence distance matrix format
definitions: Format of a matrix of genetic distances between molecular sequences.

label: Sequence motif format
definitions: Format of a sequence motif.

label: Sequence profile format
definitions: Format of a sequence profile.

label: Hidden Markov model format
definitions: Format of a hidden Markov model.

label: Dirichlet distribution format
definitions: Data format of a dirichlet distribution.

label: HMM emission and transition counts format
definitions: Data format for the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.

label: RNA secondary structure format
definitions: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.

label: Protein secondary structure format
definitions: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein molecule.

label: Sequence range format
definitions: Format used to specify range(s) of sequence positions.

label: pure
definitions: Alphabet for molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

label: unpure
definitions: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.

label: unambiguous sequence
definitions: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity characters.

label: ambiguous
definitions: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.

label: Sequence features (repeats) format
definitions: Format used for map of repeats in molecular (typically nucleotide) sequences.

label: Nucleic acid features (restriction sites) format
definitions: Format used for report on restriction enzyme recognition sites in nucleotide sequences.

label: Sequence cluster format
definitions: Format used for clusters of molecular sequences.

label: Sequence cluster format (protein)
definitions: Format used for clusters of protein sequences.

label: Sequence cluster format (nucleic acid)
definitions: Format used for clusters of nucleotide sequences.

label: EMBL-like (text)
definitions: A text format resembling EMBL entry format.
This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like text formats.

label: FASTQ-like format (text)
definitions: A text format resembling FASTQ short read format.
This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.

label: EMBLXML
definitions: XML format for EMBL entries.

label: cdsxml
definitions: XML format for EMBL entries.

label: insdxml
definitions: XML format for EMBL entries.

label: geneseq
definitions: Geneseq sequence format.

label: UniProt-like (text)
definitions: A text sequence format resembling uniprotkb entry format.

label: medline
definitions: Abstract format used by MedLine database.

label: Ontology format
definitions: Format used for ontologies.

label: OBO format
definitions: A serialisation format conforming to the Open Biomedical Ontologies (OBO) model.

label: OWL format
definitions: A serialisation format conforming to the Web Ontology Language (OWL) model.

label: FASTA-like (text)
definitions: A text format resembling FASTA format.
This concept may also be used for the many non-standard FASTA-like formats.

label: EMBL format (XML)
definitions: An XML format for EMBL entries.
This is a placeholder for other more specific concepts. It should not normally be used for annotation.

label: GenBank-like format (text)
definitions: A text format resembling GenBank entry (plain text) format.
This concept may be used for the non-standard GenBank-like text formats.

label: Sequence feature table format (text)
definitions: Text format for a sequence feature table.

label: STRING entry format (XML)
definitions: Entry format (XML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.

label: GFF
definitions: GFF feature format (of indeterminate version).

label: GTF
definitions: Gene Transfer Format (GTF), a restricted version of GFF.

label: FASTA-HTML
definitions: FASTA format wrapped in HTML elements.

label: EMBL-HTML
definitions: EMBL entry format wrapped in HTML elements.

label: Textual format
definitions: Textual format.
Data in text format can be compressed into binary format, or can be a value of an XML element or attribute. Markup formats are not considered textual (or more precisely, not plain-textual).

label: HTML
definitions: HTML format.

label: XML
definitions: eXtensible Markup Language (XML) format.
Data in XML format can be serialised into text, or binary format.

label: Binary format
definitions: Binary format.

Only specific native binary formats are listed under 'Binary format' in EDAM. Generic binary formats - such as any data being zipped, or any XML data being serialised into the Efficient XML Interchange (EXI) format - are not modelled in EDAM. Refer to http://wsio.org/compression_004.

label: Format (by type of data)
definitions: A placeholder concept for visual navigation by dividing data formats by the content of the data that is represented.

This concept exists only to assist EDAM maintenance and navigation in graphical browsers.  It does not add semantic information. The concept branch under 'Format (typed)' provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under the other top-level branches ('Binary', 'HTML', 'RDF', 'Text' and 'XML'. All concepts under here are already included under those branches.

label: BioXSD (XML)
definitions: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.

label: RDF format
definitions: A serialisation format conforming to the Resource Description Framework (RDF) model.

label: GenBank-HTML
definitions: Genbank entry format wrapped in HTML elements.

label: EMBL-like format
definitions: A format resembling EMBL entry (plain text) format.
This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like formats.

label: FASTQ-like format
definitions: A format resembling FASTQ short read format.
This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.

label: FASTA-like
definitions: A format resembling FASTA format.
This concept may be used for the many non-standard FASTA-like formats.

label: uniprotkb-like format
definitions: A sequence format resembling uniprotkb entry format.

label: Sequence feature table format
definitions: Format for a sequence feature table.

label: OBO
definitions: OBO ontology text format.

label: OBO-XML
definitions: OBO ontology XML format.

definitions: Data format for a molecular sequence record.

definitions: Data format for a molecular sequence record.

label: Sequence feature table format (XML)
definitions: XML format for a sequence feature table.

definitions: Text format for molecular sequence alignment information.

definitions: An XML format resembling EMBL entry format.

definitions: A format resembling GenBank entry (plain text) format.

label: completely unambiguous
definitions: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without any unknown positions or ambiguity characters.

label: completely unambiguous pure
definitions: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide
definitions: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .

definitions: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

label: Raw sequence format
definitions: Format of a raw molecular sequence (i.e. the alphabet used).

label: BAM
definitions: BAM format, the binary, BGZF-formatted compressed version of SAM format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.

label: SAM
definitions: Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.

The format supports short and long reads (up to 128Mbp) produced by different sequencing platforms and is used to hold mapped data within the GATK and across the Broad Institute, the Sanger Centre, and throughout the 1000 Genomes project.

label: SBML
definitions: Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), the standard XML format for models of biological processes such as for example metabolism, cell signaling, and gene regulation.

label: completely unambiguous pure protein
definitions: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

label: Bibliographic reference format
definitions: Format of a bibliographic reference.

label: Sequence annotation track format
definitions: Format of a sequence annotation track.

label: Alignment format (pair only)
definitions: Data format for molecular sequence alignment information that can hold sequence alignment(s) of only 2 sequences.

label: Sequence variation annotation format
definitions: Format of sequence variation annotation.

label: markx0 variant
definitions: Some variant of Pearson MARKX alignment format.

label: mega variant
definitions: Some variant of Mega format for (typically aligned) sequences.

label: Phylip format variant
definitions: Some variant of Phylip format for (aligned) sequences.

label: AB1
definitions: AB1 binary format of raw DNA sequence reads (output of Applied Biosystems' sequencing analysis software). Contains an electropherogram and the DNA base sequence.
AB1 uses the generic binary Applied Biosystems, Inc. Format (ABIF).

label: ACE
definitions: ACE sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata (version Aug 1998 and onwards).

label: BED
definitions: Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track, typically to be displayed in a genome browser.

BED detail format includes 2 additional columns (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format1.7) and BED 15 includes 3 additional columns for experiment scores (http://genomewiki.ucsc.edu/index.php/Microarray_track).

label: bigBed
definitions: bigBed format for large sequence annotation tracks, similar to textual BED format.

label: WIG
definitions: Wiggle format (WIG) of a sequence annotation track that consists of a value for each sequence position. Typically to be displayed in a genome browser.

label: bigWig
definitions: bigWig format for large sequence annotation tracks that consist of a value for each sequence position. Similar to textual WIG format.

label: PSL
definitions: PSL format of alignments, typically generated by BLAT or psLayout. Can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track.

label: MAF
definitions: Multiple Alignment Format (MAF) supporting alignments of whole genomes with rearrangements, directions, multiple pieces to the alignment, and so forth.

Typically generated by Multiz and TBA aligners; can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track. This should not be confused with MIRA Assembly Format or Mutation Annotation Format.

label: 2bit
definitions: 2bit binary format of nucleotide sequences using 2 bits per nucleotide. In addition encodes unknown nucleotides and lower-case 'masking'.

label: .nib
definitions: .nib (nibble) binary format of a nucleotide sequence using 4 bits per nucleotide (including unknown) and its lower-case 'masking'.

label: genePred
definitions: genePred table format for gene prediction tracks.
genePred format has 3 main variations (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format9 http://www.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/genePred). They reflect UCSC Browser DB tables.

label: pgSnp
definitions: Personal Genome SNP (pgSnp) format for sequence variation tracks (indels and polymorphisms), supported by the UCSC Genome Browser.

label: axt
definitions: axt format of alignments, typically produced from BLASTZ.

label: LAV
definitions: LAV format of alignments generated by BLASTZ and LASTZ.

label: Pileup
definitions: Pileup format of alignment of sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). Contains aligned bases per base of the reference sequence(s).

label: VCF
definitions: Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).

label: SRF
definitions: Sequence Read Format (SRF) of sequence trace data. Supports submission to the NCBI Short Read Archive.

label: ZTR
definitions: ZTR format for storing chromatogram data from DNA sequencing instruments.

label: GVF
definitions: Genome Variation Format (GVF). A GFF3-compatible format with defined header and attribute tags for sequence variation.

label: BCF
definitions: BCF, the binary version of Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).

label: Matrix format
definitions: Format of a matrix (array) of numerical values.

label: Protein domain classification format
definitions: Format of data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).

label: Raw SCOP domain classification format
definitions: Format of raw SCOP domain classification data files.
These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.

label: Raw CATH domain classification format
definitions: Format of raw CATH domain classification data files.
These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.

label: CATH domain report format
definitions: Format of summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.
The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.

label: SBRML
definitions: Systems Biology Result Markup Language (SBRML), the standard XML format for simulated or calculated results (e.g. trajectories) of systems biology models.

label: BioPAX
definitions: BioPAX is an exchange format for pathway data, with its data model defined in OWL.

label: EBI Application Result XML
definitions: EBI Application Result XML is a format returned by sequence similarity search Web services at EBI.

label: PSI MI XML (MIF)
definitions: XML Molecular Interaction Format (MIF), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.

label: phyloXML
definitions: phyloXML is a standardised XML format for phylogenetic trees, networks, and associated data.

label: NeXML
definitions: NeXML is a standardised XML format for rich phyloinformatic data.

label: MAGE-ML
definitions: MAGE-ML XML format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).

label: MAGE-TAB
definitions: MAGE-TAB textual format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).

label: GCDML
definitions: GCDML XML format for genome and metagenome metadata according to MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS information standards, standardised by the Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC).

label: GTrack
definitions: GTrack is a generic and optimised tabular format for genome or sequence feature tracks. GTrack unifies the power of other track formats (e.g. GFF3, BED, WIG), and while optimised in size, adds more flexibility, customisation, and automation ("machine understandability").

label: Biological pathway or network report format
definitions: Data format for a report of information derived from a biological pathway or network.

label: Experiment annotation format
definitions: Data format for annotation on a laboratory experiment.

label: Cytoband format
definitions: Cytoband format for chromosome cytobands.
Reflects a UCSC Browser DB table.

label: CopasiML
definitions: CopasiML, the native format of COPASI.

label: CellML
definitions: CellML, the format for mathematical models of biological and other networks.

label: PSI MI TAB (MITAB)
definitions: Tabular Molecular Interaction format (MITAB), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.

label: PSI-PAR
definitions: Protein affinity format (PSI-PAR), standardised by HUPO PSI MI. It is compatible with PSI MI XML (MIF) and uses the same XML Schema.

label: mzML
definitions: mzML format for raw spectrometer output data, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
mzML is the successor and unifier of the mzData format developed by PSI and mzXML developed at the Seattle Proteome Center.

label: Mass spectrometry data format
definitions: Format for mass pectra and derived data, include peptide sequences etc.

label: TraML
definitions: TraML (Transition Markup Language) is the format for mass spectrometry transitions, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.

label: mzIdentML
definitions: mzIdentML is the exchange format for peptides and proteins identified from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of proteomics search engines.

label: mzQuantML
definitions: mzQuantML is the format for quantitation values associated with peptides, proteins and small molecules from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of quantitation software for proteomics.

label: GelML
definitions: GelML is the format for describing the process of gel electrophoresis, standardised by HUPO PSI PS.

label: spML
definitions: spML is the format for describing proteomics sample processing, other than using gels, prior to mass spectrometric protein identification, standardised by HUPO PSI PS. It may also be applicable for metabolomics.

label: OWL Functional Syntax
definitions: A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).

label: Manchester OWL Syntax
definitions: A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.

label: KRSS2 Syntax
definitions: A superset of the "Description-Logic Knowledge Representation System Specification from the KRSS Group of the ARPA Knowledge Sharing Effort".
This format is used in Protege 4.

label: Turtle
definitions: The Terse RDF Triple Language (Turtle) is a human-friendly serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs.
The SPARQL Query Language incorporates a very similar syntax.

label: N-Triples
definitions: A plain text serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs, and a subset of the Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) format.
N-Triples should not be confused with Notation 3 which is a superset of Turtle.

label: Notation3
definitions: A shorthand non-XML serialisation of Resource Description Framework model, designed with human-readability in mind.

label: RDF/XML
definitions: Resource Description Framework (RDF) XML format.
RDF/XML is a serialisation syntax for OWL DL, but not for OWL Full.

label: OWL/XML
definitions: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.

label: A2M
definitions: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.

label: SFF
definitions: Standard flowgram format (SFF) is a binary file format used to encode results of pyrosequencing from the 454 Life Sciences platform for high-throughput sequencing.

label: MAP
definitions: The MAP file describes SNPs and is used by the Plink package.

label: PED
definitions: The PED file describes individuals and genetic data and is used by the Plink package.

label: Individual genetic data format
definitions: Data format for a metadata on an individual and their genetic data.

label: PED/MAP
definitions: The PED/MAP file describes data used by the Plink package.

label: CT
definitions: File format of a CT (Connectivity Table) file from the RNAstructure package.

label: SS
definitions: XRNA old input style format.

label: RNAML
definitions: RNA Markup Language.

label: GDE
definitions: Format for the Genetic Data Environment (GDE).

label: BLC
definitions: A multiple alignment in vertical format, as used in the AMPS (Alignment of Multiple Protein Sequences) pacakge.

label: Data index format
definitions: Format of a data index of some type.

label: BAI
definitions: BAM indexing format

label: HMMER2
definitions: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 2.x

label: HMMER3
definitions: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 3.x

label: PO
definitions: EMBOSS simple sequence pair alignment format.

label: BLAST XML results format
definitions: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package

label: CRAM
definitions: Reference-based compression of alignment format

label: JSON
definitions: JavaScript Object Notation format; a lightweight, text-based format to represent tree-structured data using key-value pairs.

label: EPS
definitions: Encapsulated PostScript format

label: GIF
definitions: Graphics Interchange Format.

label: xls
definitions: Microsoft Excel spreadsheet format.

label: TSV
definitions: Tabular data represented as tab-separated values in a text file.

label: Cytoscape input file format
definitions: Format of the cytoscape input file of gene expression ratios or values are specified over one or more experiments.

label: ebwt
definitions: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "small" genomes.

label: RSF
definitions: Rich sequence format.

RSF-format files contain one or more sequences that may or may not be related. In addition to the sequence data, each sequence can be annotated with descriptive sequence information (from the GCG manual).

label: GCG format variant
definitions: Some format based on the GCG format.

label: BSML
definitions: Bioinformatics Sequence Markup Language format.

label: ebwtl
definitions: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "large" genomes.

label: Ensembl variation file format
definitions: Ensembl standard format for variation data.

label: docx
definitions: Microsoft Word format.

label: Document format
definitions: Format of documents including word processor, spreadsheet and presentation.

label: PDF
definitions: Portable Document Format

label: Image format
definitions: Format used for images and image metadata.

label: DICOM format
definitions: Medical image format corresponding to the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard.

label: nii
definitions: Medical image and metadata format of the Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative.

label: mhd
definitions: Text-based tagged file format for medical images generated using the MetaImage software package.

label: nrrd
definitions: Nearly Raw Rasta Data format designed to support scientific visualisation and image processing involving N-dimensional raster data.

label: R file format
definitions: File format used for scripts written in the R programming language for execution within the R software environment, typically for statistical computation and graphics.

label: SPSS
definitions: File format used for scripts for the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences.

label: MHTML
definitions: MIME  HTML format for Web pages, which can include external resources, including images, Flash animations and so on.

label: IDAT
definitions: Proprietary file format for (raw) BeadArray data used by genomewide profiling platforms from Illumina Inc. This format is output directly from the scanner and stores summary intensities for each probe-type on an array.

label: JPG
definitions: Joint Picture Group file format for lossy graphics file.
Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.

label: rcc
definitions: Reporter Code Count-A data file (.csv) output by the Nanostring nCounter Digital Analyzer, which contains gene sample information, probe information and probe counts.

label: arff
definitions: ARFF (Attribute-Relation File Format) is an ASCII text file format that describes a list of instances sharing a set of attributes.
This file format is for machine learning.

label: afg
definitions: AFG is a single text-based file assembly format  that holds read and consensus information together

label: bedgraph
definitions: The bedGraph format allows display of continuous-valued data in track format. This display type is useful for probability scores and transcriptome data
Holds a tab-delimited chromosome /start /end / datavalue dataset.

label: bedstrict
definitions: Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track that strictly does not contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns.
Galaxy allows BED files to contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns, some other implementations do not.

label: bed6
definitions: BED file format where each feature is described by chromosome, start, end, name, score, and strand.
Tab delimited data in strict BED format - no non-standard columns allowed; column count forced to 6

label: bed12
definitions: A BED file where each feature is described by all twelve columns.
Tab delimited data in strict BED format - no non-standard columns allowed; column count forced to 12

label: chrominfo
definitions: Tabular format of chromosome names and sizes used by Galaxy.
Galaxy allows BED files to contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns, some other implementations do not.

label: customtrack
definitions: Custom Sequence annotation track format used by Galaxy.
Used for tracks/track views within galaxy.

label: csfasta
definitions: Color space FASTA format sequence variant.
FASTA format extended for color space information.

label: hdf5
definitions: HDF5 is a generic hierarchical data file format used to store and organize large amounts of data.
An HDF5 file appears to the user as a directed graph. The nodes of this graph are the higher-level HDF5 objects that are exposed by the HDF5 APIs: Groups, Datasets, Named datatypes.

label: tiff
definitions: A versatile bitmap format.

The TIFF format is perhaps the most versatile and diverse bitmap format in existence. Its extensible nature and support for numerous data compression schemes allow developers to customize the TIFF format to fit any peculiar data storage needs.

label: bmp
definitions: Standard bitmap storage format in the Microsoft Windows environment.
Although it is based on Windows internal bitmap data structures, it is supported by many non-Windows and non-PC applications.

label: im
definitions: IM is a format used by LabEye and other applications based on the IFUNC image processing library.
IFUNC library reads and writes most uncompressed interchange versions of this format.

label: pcd
definitions: Photo CD format, which is the highest resolution format for images on a CD.

PCD was developed by Kodak. A PCD file contains five different resolution (ranging from low to high) of a slide or film negative. Due to it PCD is often used by many photographers and graphics professionals for high-end printed applications.

label: pcx
definitions: PCX is an image file format that uses a simple form of run-length encoding. It is lossless.

label: ppm
definitions: The PPM format is a lowest common denominator color image file format.

label: psd
definitions: PSD (Photoshop Document) is a proprietary file that allows the user to work with the images’ individual layers even after the file has been saved.

label: xbm
definitions: X BitMap is a plain text binary image format used by the X Window System used for storing cursor and icon bitmaps used in the X GUI.
The XBM format was replaced by XPM for X11 in 1989.

label: xpm
definitions: X PixMap (XPM) is an image file format used by the X Window System, it is intended primarily for creating icon pixmaps, and supports transparent pixels.
Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.

label: rgb
definitions: RGB file format is the native raster graphics file format for Silicon Graphics workstations.

label: pbm
definitions: The PBM format is a lowest common denominator monochrome file format. It serves as the common language of a large family of bitmap image conversion filters.

label: pgm
definitions: The PGM format is a lowest common denominator grayscale file format.
It is designed to be extremely easy to learn and write programs for.

label: PNG
definitions: PNG is a file format for image compression.
It iis expected to replace the Graphics Interchange Format (GIF).

label: SVG
definitions: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.
The SVG specification is an open standard developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) since 1999.

label: rast
definitions: Sun Raster is a raster graphics file format used on SunOS by Sun Microsystems
The SVG specification is an open standard developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) since 1999.

label: Sequence quality report format (text)
definitions: Textual report format for sequence quality for reports from sequencing machines.

label: qual
definitions: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences).
Phred quality scores  are defined as a property which is logarithmically related to the base-calling error probabilities.

label: qualsolexa
definitions: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)

label: qualillumina
definitions: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.

Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.

label: qualsolid
definitions: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for SOLiD data.
For SOLiD data, the sequence is in color space, except the first position. The quality values are those of the Sanger format.

label: qual454
definitions: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from 454 sequencers.

label: ENCODE peak format
definitions: Human ENCODE peak format.
Format that covers both the broad peak format and narrow peak format from ENCODE.

label: ENCODE narrow peak format
definitions: Human ENCODE narrow peak format.
Format that covers both the broad peak format and narrow peak format from ENCODE.

label: ENCODE broad peak format
definitions: Human ENCODE broad peak format.

label: bgzip
definitions: Blocked GNU Zip format.
BAM files are compressed using a variant of GZIP (GNU ZIP), into a format called BGZF (Blocked GNU Zip Format).

label: tabix
definitions: TAB-delimited genome position file index format.

label: Graph format
definitions: Data format for graph data.

label: xgmml
definitions: XML-based format used to store graph descriptions within Galaxy.

label: sif
definitions: SIF (simple interaction file) Format - a network/pathway format used for instance in cytoscape.

label: xlsx
definitions: MS Excel spreadsheet format consisting of a set of XML documents stored in a ZIP-compressed file.

label: SQLite format
definitions: Data format used by the SQLite database.

label: Gemini SQLite format
definitions: Data format used by the SQLite database conformant to the Gemini schema.

label: snpeffdb
definitions: An index of a genome database, indexed for use by the snpeff tool.

label: MAT
definitions: Binary format used by MATLAB files to store workspace variables.

label: netCDF
definitions: Format used by netCDF software  library for writing and reading chromatography-MS data files.

label: MGF
definitions: Mascot Generic Format.  Encodes multiple MS/MS spectra in a single file.
Files includes *m*/*z*, intensity pairs separated by headers; headers can contain a bit more information, including search engine instructions.

label: dta
definitions: Spectral data format file where each spectrum is written to a separate file.

Each file contains one header line for the known or assumed charge and the mass of the precursor peptide ion, calculated from the measured *m*/*z* and the charge. This one line was then followed by all the *m*/*z*, intensity pairs that represent the spectrum.

label: pkl
definitions: Spectral data file similar to dta.
Differ from .dta only in subtleties of the header line format and content and support the added feature of being able to.

label: mzXML
definitions: Common file format for proteomics mass spectrometric data developed at the Seattle Proteome Center/Institute for Systems Biology.

label: pepXML
definitions: Open data format for the storage, exchange, and processing of peptide sequence assignments of MS/MS scans, intended to provide a common data output format for many different MS/MS search engines and subsequent peptide-level analyses.

label: GPML
definitions: Graphical Pathway Markup Language (GPML) is an XML format used for exchanging biological pathways.

label: K-mer countgraph
definitions: A list of k-mers and their occurences in a dataset. Can also be used as an implicit De Bruijn graph.

label: mzTab
definitions: mzTab is a tab-delimited format for mass spectrometry-based proteomics and metabolomics results.

label: imzML metadata file
definitions: imzML metadata is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging metadata.
imzML data are recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra. This entry is for the metadata XML file

label: qcML
definitions: qcML is an XML format for quality-related data of mass spectrometry and other high-throughput measurements.
The focus of qcML is towards mass spectrometry based proteomics, but the format is suitable for metabolomics and sequencing as well.

label: PRIDE XML
definitions: PRIDE XML is an XML format for mass spectra, peptide and protein identifications, and metadata about a corresponding measurement, sample, experiment.

label: SED-ML
definitions: Simulation Experiment Description Markup Language (SED-ML) is an XML format for encoding simulation setups, according to the MIASE (Minimum Information About a Simulation Experiment) requirements.

label: COMBINE OMEX
definitions: Open Modeling EXchange format (OMEX) is a ZIPped format for encapsulating all information necessary for a modeling and simulation project in systems biology.

An OMEX file is a ZIP container that includes a manifest file, listing the content of the archive, an optional metadata file adding information about the archive and its content, and the files describing the model. OMEX is one of the standardised formats within COMBINE (Computational Modeling in Biology Network).

label: ISA-TAB
definitions:
The Investigation / Study / Assay (ISA) tab-delimited (TAB) format incorporates metadata from 
experiments employing a combination of technologies.
ISA-TAB is based on MAGE-TAB. Other than tabular, the ISA model can also be represented in RDF, and in JSON (compliable with a set of defined JSON Schemata).

label: SBtab
definitions: SBtab is a tabular format for biochemical network models.

label: BCML
definitions: Biological Connection Markup Language (BCML) is an XML format for biological pathways.

label: BDML
definitions: Biological Dynamics Markup Language (BDML) is an XML format for quantitative data describing biological dynamics.

label: BEL
definitions: Biological Expression Language (BEL) is a textual format for representing scientific findings in life sciences in a computable form.

label: SBGN-ML
definitions: SBGN-ML is an XML format for Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) diagrams of biological pathways or networks.

label: AGP
definitions: AGP is a tabular format for a sequence assembly (a contig, a scaffold/supercontig, or a chromosome).

label: PS
definitions: PostScript format

label: SRA format
definitions: SRA archive format (SRA) is the archive format used for input to the NCBI Sequence Read Archive.

label: VDB
definitions: VDB ('vertical database') is the native format used for export from the NCBI Sequence Read Archive.

label: Tabix index file format
definitions: Index file format used by the samtools package to index TAB-delimited genome position files.

label: Sequin format
definitions: A five-column, tab-delimited table of feature locations and qualifiers for importing annotation into an existing Sequin submission (an NCBI tool for submitting and updating GenBank entries).

label: MSF
definitions: Proprietary mass-spectrometry format of Thermo Scientific's ProteomeDiscoverer software.

This format corresponds to an SQLite database, and you can look into the files with e.g. SQLiteStudio3. There are also some readers (http://doi.org/10.1021/pr2005154) and converters (http://doi.org/10.1016/j.jprot.2015.06.015) for this format available, which re-engineered the database schema, but there is no official DB schema specification of Thermo Scientific for the format.

label: Biodiversity data format
definitions: Data format for biodiversity data.

label: ABCD format
definitions: Exchange format of the Access to Biological Collections Data (ABCD) Schema; a standard for the access to and exchange of data about specimens and observations (primary biodiversity data).

label: GCT/Res format
definitions: Tab-delimited text files of GenePattern that contain a column for each sample, a row for each gene, and an expression value for each gene in each sample.

label: WIFF format
definitions: Mass spectrum file format from QSTAR and QTRAP instruments (ABI/Sciex).

label: X!Tandem XML
definitions: Output format used by X! series search engines that is based on the XML language BIOML.

label: Thermo RAW
definitions: Proprietary file format for mass spectrometry data from Thermo Scientific.
Proprietary format for which documentation is not available.

label: Mascot .dat file
definitions: "Raw" result file from Mascot database search.

label: MaxQuant APL peaklist format
definitions: Format of peak list files from Andromeda search engine (MaxQuant) that consist of arbitrarily many spectra.

label: SBOL
definitions: Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) is an XML format for the specification and exchange of biological design information in synthetic biology.
SBOL introduces a standardised format for the electronic exchange of information on the structural and functional aspects of biological designs.

label: PMML
definitions: PMML uses XML to represent mining models. The structure of the models is described by an XML Schema.
One or more mining models can be contained in a PMML document.

label: OME-TIFF
definitions: Image file format used by the Open Microscopy Environment (OME).

An OME-TIFF dataset consists of one or more files in standard TIFF or BigTIFF format, with the file extension .ome.tif or .ome.tiff, and an identical (or in the case of multiple files, nearly identical) string of OME-XML metadata embedded in the ImageDescription tag of each file’s first IFD (Image File Directory). BigTIFF file extensions are also permitted, with the file extension .ome.tf2, .ome.tf8 or .ome.btf, but note these file extensions are an addition to the original specification, and software using an older version of the specification may not be able to handle these file extensions.

OME develops open-source software and data format standards for the storage and manipulation of biological microscopy data. It is a joint project between universities, research establishments, industry and the software development community.

label: LocARNA PP
definitions: The LocARNA PP format combines sequence or alignment information and (respectively, single or consensus) ensemble probabilities into an PP 2.0 record.

Format for multiple aligned or single sequences together with the probabilistic description of the (consensus) RNA secondary structure ensemble by probabilities of base pairs, base pair stackings, and base pairs and unpaired bases in the loop of base pairs.

label: dbGaP format
definitions: Input format used by the Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP).

The Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) is a National Institutes of Health (NIH) sponsored repository charged to archive, curate and distribute information produced by studies investigating the interaction of genotype and phenotype.

label: BIOM format
definitions: The BIological Observation Matrix (BIOM) is a format for representing biological sample by observation contingency tables in broad areas of comparative omics. The primary use of this format is to represent OTU tables and metagenome tables.
BIOM is a recognised standard for the Earth Microbiome Project, and is a project supported by Genomics Standards Consortium. Supported in QIIME, Mothur, MEGAN, etc.

label: protXML
definitions: A format for storage, exchange, and processing of protein identifications created from ms/ms-derived peptide sequence data.
No human-consumable information about this format is available (see http://tools.proteomecenter.org/wiki/index.php?title=Formats:protXML).

label: Linked data format
definitions: A linked data format enables publishing structured data as linked data (Linked Data), so that the data can be interlinked and become more useful through semantic queries.

label: JSON-LD
synonyms: JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data
definitions: JSON-LD, or JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data, is a method of encoding Linked Data using JSON.

label: YAML
definitions: YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) is a human-readable tree-structured data serialisation language.
Data in YAML format can be serialised into text, or binary format.
YAML version 1.2 is a superset of JSON; prior versions were "not strictly compatible".

label: DSV
definitions: Tabular data represented as values in a text file delimited by some character.

label: CSV
definitions: Tabular data represented as comma-separated values in a text file.

label: SEQUEST .out file
definitions: "Raw" result file from SEQUEST database search.

label: idXML
definitions: XML file format for files containing information about peptide identifications from mass spectrometry data analysis carried out with OpenMS.

label: KNIME datatable format
definitions: Data table formatted such that it can be passed/streamed within the KNIME platform.

label: UniProtKB XML
definitions: UniProtKB XML sequence features format is an XML format available for downloading UniProt entries.

label: UniProtKB RDF
definitions: UniProtKB RDF sequence features format is an RDF format available for downloading UniProt entries (in RDF/XML).

label: BioJSON (BioXSD)
definitions: BioJSON is a BioXSD-schema-based JSON format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web applications and APIs, and object-oriented programming.

label: BioYAML
definitions: BioYAML is a BioXSD-schema-based YAML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web APIs, human readability and editting, and object-oriented programming.

label: BioJSON (Jalview)
definitions: BioJSON is a JSON format of single multiple sequence alignments, with their annotations, features, and custom visualisation and application settings for the Jalview workbench.

label: GSuite
definitions: GSuite is a tabular format for collections of genome or sequence feature tracks, suitable for integrative multi-track analysis. GSuite contains links to genome/sequence tracks, with additional metadata.

label: BTrack
definitions: BTrack is an HDF5-based binary format for genome or sequence feature tracks and their collections, suitable for integrative multi-track analysis. BTrack is a binary, compressed alternative to the GTrack and GSuite formats.

label: MCPD
definitions: The FAO/Bioversity/IPGRI Multi-Crop Passport Descriptors (MCPD) is an international standard format for exchange of germplasm information.

label: Annotated text format
definitions: Data format of an annotated text, e.g. with recognised entities, concepts, and relations.

label: PubAnnotation format
definitions: JSON format of annotated scientific text used by PubAnnotations and other tools.

label: BioC
definitions: BioC is a standardised XML format for sharing and integrating text data and annotations.

label: PubTator format
definitions: Native textual export format of annotated scientific text from PubTator.

label: Open Annotation format
definitions: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.

label: BioNLP Shared Task format
definitions: A family of similar formats of text annotation, used by BRAT and other tools, known as BioNLP Shared Task format (BioNLP 2009 Shared Task on Event Extraction, BioNLP Shared Task 2011, BioNLP Shared Task 2013), BRAT format, BRAT standoff format, and similar.

label: Query language
definitions: A query language (format) for structured database queries.

label: SQL
definitions: SQL (Structured Query Language) is the de-facto standard query language (format of queries) for querying and manipulating data in relational databases.

label: XQuery
definitions: XQuery (XML Query) is a query language (format of queries) for querying and manipulating structured and unstructured data, usually in the form of XML, text, and with vendor-specific extensions for other data formats (JSON, binary, etc.).

label: SPARQL
synonyms: SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language
definitions: SPARQL (SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language) is a semantic query language for querying and manipulating data stored in Resource Description Framework (RDF) format.

label: xsd
definitions: XML format for XML Schema.

label: XMFA
definitions: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.

label: GEN
definitions: The GEN file format contains genetic data and describes SNPs.

label: SAMPLE file format
definitions: The SAMPLE file format contains information about each individual i.e. individual IDs, covariates, phenotypes and missing data proportions, from a GWAS study.

label: SDF
definitions: SDF is one of a family of chemical-data file formats developed by MDL Information Systems; it is intended especially for structural information.

label: Molfile
definitions: An MDL Molfile is a file format for holding information about the atoms, bonds, connectivity and coordinates of a molecule.

label: Mol2
definitions: Complete, portable representation of a SYBYL molecule. ASCII file which contains all the information needed to reconstruct a SYBYL molecule.

label: latex
definitions: format for the LaTeX document preparation system
uses the TeX typesetting program format

label: ELAND format
definitions: Tab-delimited text file format used by Eland - the read-mapping program distributed by Illumina with its sequencing analysis pipeline - which maps short Solexa sequence reads to the human reference genome.

label: Relaxed PHYLIP Interleaved
definitions: Phylip multiple alignment sequence format, less stringent than PHYLIP format.

It differs from Phylip Format (format_1997) on length of the ID sequence. There no length restrictions on the ID, but whitespaces aren't allowed in the sequence ID/Name because one space separates the longest ID and the beginning of the sequence. Sequences IDs must be padded to the longest ID length.

label: Relaxed PHYLIP Sequential
definitions: Phylip multiple alignment sequence format, less stringent than PHYLIP sequential format (format_1998).

It differs from Phylip sequential format (format_1997) on length of the ID sequence. There no length restrictions on the ID, but whitespaces aren't allowed in the sequence ID/Name because one space separates the longest ID and the beginning of the sequence. Sequences IDs must be padded to the longest ID length.

label: VisML
definitions: Default XML format of VisANT, containing all the network information.

label: GML
definitions: GML (Graph Modeling Language) is a text file format supporting network data with a very easy syntax. It is used by Graphlet, Pajek, yEd, LEDA and NetworkX.

label: FASTG
definitions: FASTG is a format for faithfully representing genome assemblies in the face of allelic polymorphism and assembly uncertainty.
It is called FASTG, like FASTA, but the G stands for ‘graph’.

label: Raw NMR data format
synonyms: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy data format
definitions: Data format for raw data from a nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy experiment.

label: nmrML
definitions: nmrML is an MSI supported XML-based open access format for metabolomics NMR raw and processed spectral data. It is accompanies by an nmrCV (controlled vocabulary) to allow ontology-based annotations.

label: proBAM
definitions: . proBAM is an adaptation of BAM (format_2572), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.

label: proBED
definitions: . proBED is an adaptation of BED (format_3003), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.

label: Raw microarray data format
definitions: Data format for raw microarray data.

label: GPR
definitions: GenePix Results (GPR) text file format developed by Axon Instruments that is used to save GenePix Results data.

label: ARB
definitions: Binary format used by the ARB software suite

label: consensusXML
definitions: OpenMS format for grouping features in one map or across several maps.

label: featureXML
definitions: OpenMS format for quantitation results (LC/MS features).

label: mzData
definitions: Now deprecated data format of the HUPO Proteomics Standards Initiative.  Replaced by mzML (format_3244).

label: TIDE TXT
definitions: Format supported by the Tide tool for identifying peptides from tandem mass spectra.

label: BLAST XML v2 results format
definitions: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package v2.

label: pptx
definitions: Microsoft Powerpoint format.

label: ibd
definitions: ibd is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging data.
imzML data is recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra.

label: Operation
definitions: A function that processes a set of inputs and results in a set of outputs, or associates arguments (inputs) with values (outputs).

Special cases are: a) An operation that consumes no input (has no input arguments). Such operation is either a constant function, or an operation depending only on the underlying state. b) An operation that may modify the underlying state but has no output. c) The singular-case operation with no input or output, that still may modify the underlying state.

label: Query and retrieval
definitions: Search or query a data resource and retrieve entries and / or annotation.

label: Annotation
definitions: Annotate an entity (typically a biological or biomedical database entity) with terms from a controlled vocabulary.
This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.

label: Indexing
definitions: Generate an index of (typically a file of) biological data.

label: Sequence generation
definitions: Generate a molecular sequence by some means.

label: Sequence editing
definitions: Edit or change a molecular sequence, either randomly or specifically.

label: Sequence merging
definitions: Merge two or more (typically overlapping) molecular sequences.

label: Sequence conversion
definitions: Convert a molecular sequence from one type to another.

label: Sequence complexity calculation
definitions: Calculate sequence complexity, for example to find low-complexity regions in sequences.

label: Sequence ambiguity calculation
definitions: Calculate sequence ambiguity, for example identity regions in protein or nucleotide sequences with many ambiguity codes.

label: Sequence composition calculation
definitions: Calculate character or word composition or frequency of a molecular sequence.

label: Repeat sequence analysis
definitions: Find and/or analyse repeat sequences in (typically nucleotide) sequences.

Repeat sequences include tandem repeats, inverted or palindromic repeats, DNA microsatellites (Simple Sequence Repeats or SSRs), interspersed repeats, maximal duplications and reverse, complemented and reverse complemented repeats etc. Repeat units can be exact or imperfect, in tandem or dispersed, of specified or unspecified length.

label: Sequence motif discovery
definitions: Discover new motifs or conserved patterns in sequences or sequence alignments (de-novo discovery).
Motifs and patterns might be conserved or over-represented (occur with improbable frequency).

label: Sequence motif recognition
definitions: Find (scan for) known motifs, patterns and regular expressions in molecular sequence(s).

label: Sequence motif comparison
definitions: Find motifs shared by molecular sequences.

label: Protein flexibility and motion analysis
definitions: Analyse flexibility and motion in protein structure.

Use this concept for analysis of flexible and rigid residues, local chain deformability, regions undergoing conformational change, molecular vibrations or fluctuational dynamics, domain motions or other large-scale structural transitions in a protein structure.

label: Protein structural motif recognition
definitions: Identify or screen for 3D structural motifs in protein structure(s).

This includes conserved substructures and conserved geometry, such as spatial arrangement of secondary structure or protein backbone. Methods might use structure alignment, structural templates, searches for similar electrostatic potential and molecular surface shape, surface-mapping of phylogenetic information etc.

label: Protein domain recognition
definitions: Identify structural domains in a protein structure from first principles (for example calculations on structural compactness).

label: Protein architecture analysis
definitions: Analyse the architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure) of protein structure(s).

label: Residue interaction calculation
definitions: Calculate or extract inter-atomic, inter-residue or residue-atom contacts, distances and interactions in protein structure(s).

label: Protein geometry calculation
definitions: Calculate, visualise or analyse phi/psi angles of a protein structure.

label: Protein property calculation
definitions: Extract, calculate or predict non-positional (physical or chemical) properties of a protein, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence, from processing a protein sequence or 3D structure.

This includes methods to render and visualise the properties of a protein sequence, and a residue-level search for properties such as solvent accessibility, hydropathy, secondary structure, ligand-binding etc.

label: Peptide immunogenicity prediction
definitions: Predict antigenicity, allergenicity / immunogenicity, allergic cross-reactivity etc of peptides and proteins.
This includes methods that generate a graphical rendering of antigenicity of a protein, such as a Hopp and Woods plot.
This is usually done in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.

label: Sequence feature detection
definitions: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in molecular sequences such as key functional sites or regions.
Look at "Protein feature detection" (http://edamontology.org/operation_3092) and "Nucleic acid feature detection" (http://edamontology.org/operation_0415) in case more specific terms are needed.

label: Sequence feature comparison
definitions: Compare the feature tables of two or more molecular sequences.

label: Sequence alignment analysis
definitions: Analyse a molecular sequence alignment.

label: Sequence alignment comparison
definitions: Compare (typically by aligning) two molecular sequence alignments.
See also 'Sequence profile alignment'.

label: Sequence alignment conversion
definitions: Convert a molecular sequence alignment from one type to another (for example amino acid to coding nucleotide sequence).

label: Nucleic acid property calculation
definitions: Calculate or predict physical or chemical properties of nucleic acid molecules, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence.

label: Splice transcript prediction
definitions: Predict splicing alternatives or transcript isoforms from analysis of sequence data.

label: Frameshift detection
definitions: Detect frameshifts in DNA sequences, including frameshift sites and signals, and frameshift errors from sequencing projects.
Methods include sequence alignment (if related sequences are available) and word-based sequence comparison.

label: Vector sequence detection
definitions: Detect vector sequences in nucleotide sequence, typically by comparison to a set of known vector sequences.

label: Protein secondary structure prediction
definitions: Predict secondary structure of protein sequences.

Methods might use amino acid composition, local sequence information, multiple sequence alignments, physicochemical features, estimated energy content, statistical algorithms, hidden Markov models, support vector machines, kernel machines, neural networks etc.

label: Protein super-secondary structure prediction
definitions: Predict super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).
Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.

label: Transmembrane protein prediction
definitions: Predict and/or classify transmembrane proteins or transmembrane (helical) domains or regions in protein sequences.

label: Transmembrane protein analysis
definitions: Analyse transmembrane protein(s), typically by processing sequence and / or structural data, and write an informative report for example about the protein and its transmembrane domains / regions.

Use this (or child) concept for analysis of transmembrane domains (buried and exposed faces), transmembrane helices, helix topology, orientation, inter-helical contacts, membrane dipping (re-entrant) loops and other secondary structure etc. Methods might use pattern discovery, hidden Markov models, sequence alignment, structural profiles, amino acid property analysis, comparison to known domains or some combination (hybrid methods).

label: Residue interaction prediction
definitions: Predict contacts, non-covalent interactions and distance (constraints) between amino acids in protein sequences.
Methods usually involve multiple sequence alignment analysis.

label: Protein interaction network analysis
definitions: Analyse a network of protein interactions.

label: Pathway or network comparison
definitions: Compare two or more biological pathways or networks.

label: RNA secondary structure prediction
definitions: Predict RNA secondary structure (for example knots, pseudoknots, alternative structures etc).
Methods might use RNA motifs, predicted intermolecular contacts, or RNA sequence-structure compatibility (inverse RNA folding).

label: Nucleic acid folding analysis
definitions: Analyse some aspect of RNA/DNA folding, typically by processing sequence and/or structural data.  For example, compute folding energies such as minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences or energy landscape of RNA mutants.

label: Genetic mapping
definitions: Generate a genetic (linkage) map of a DNA sequence (typically a chromosome) showing the relative positions of genetic markers based on estimation of non-physical distances.

Mapping involves ordering genetic loci along a chromosome and estimating the physical distance between loci. A genetic map shows the relative (not physical) position of known genes and genetic markers.
This includes mapping of the genetic architecture of dynamic complex traits (functional mapping), e.g. by characterisation of the underlying quantitative trait loci (QTLs) or nucleotides (QTNs).

label: Linkage analysis
definitions: Analyse genetic linkage.

For example, estimate how close two genes are on a chromosome by calculating how often they are transmitted together to an offspring, ascertain whether two genes are linked and parental linkage, calculate linkage map distance etc.

label: Codon usage table generation
definitions: Calculate codon usage statistics and create a codon usage table.

label: Codon usage table comparison
definitions: Compare two or more codon usage tables.

label: Codon usage analysis
definitions: Process (read and / or write) codon usage data, e.g. analyse codon usage tables or codon usage in molecular sequences.

label: Base position variability plotting
definitions: Identify and plot third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.

label: Sequence word comparison
definitions: Find exact character or word matches between molecular sequences without full sequence alignment.

label: Sequence distance matrix generation
definitions: Calculate a sequence distance matrix or otherwise estimate genetic distances between molecular sequences.

label: Sequence redundancy removal
definitions: Compare two or more molecular sequences, identify and remove redundant sequences based on some criteria.

label: Sequence clustering
definitions: Build clusters of similar sequences, typically using scores from pair-wise alignment or other comparison of the sequences.
The clusters may be output or used internally for some other purpose.

label: Sequence alignment
definitions: Align (identify equivalent sites within) molecular sequences.

label: Structure-based sequence alignment
definitions: Align molecular sequences using sequence and structural information.

label: Structure alignment
definitions: Align (superimpose) molecular tertiary structures.

label: Sequence profile generation
definitions: Generate some type of sequence profile (for example a hidden Markov model) from a sequence alignment.

label: 3D profile generation
definitions: Generate some type of structural (3D) profile or template from a structure or structure alignment.

label: Sequence profile alignment
definitions: Align molecular sequence(s) to sequence profile(s), or profiles to other profiles.  A profile typically represents a sequence alignment.
A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment. Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.

label: Protein threading
definitions: Align molecular sequence to structure in 3D space (threading).
Use this concept for methods that evaluate sequence-structure compatibility by assessing residue interactions in 3D. Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.

label: Protein fold recognition
definitions: Recognize (predict and identify) known protein structural domains or folds in protein sequence(s) which (typically) are not accompanied by any significant sequence similarity to know structures.

Methods use some type of mapping between sequence and fold, for example secondary structure prediction and alignment, profile comparison, sequence properties, homologous sequence search, kernel machines etc. Domains and folds might be taken from SCOP or CATH.

label: Literature search
definitions: Query scientific literature, in search for articles, article data, concepts, named entities, or for statistics.

label: Text mining
definitions: Process and analyse text (typically scientific literature) to extract information from it.

label: Virtual PCR
definitions: Perform in-silico (virtual) PCR.

label: PCR primer design
synonyms: PCR primer design (for large scale sequencing)
PCR primer design (for gene transcription profiling)
PCR primer design (based on gene structure)
definitions: Design or predict oligonucleotide primers for PCR and DNA amplification etc.

Primer design involves predicting or selecting primers that are specific to a provided PCR template. Primers can be designed with certain properties such as size of product desired, primer size etc. The output might be a minimal or overlapping primer set.

This includes predicting primers based on gene structure, promoters, exon-exon junctions, predicting primers that are conserved across multiple genomes or species, primers for for gene transcription profiling,  for genotyping polymorphisms, for example single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs),  for large scale sequencing, or for methylation PCRs.

label: Microarray probe design
definitions: Predict and/or optimize oligonucleotide probes for DNA microarrays, for example for transcription profiling of genes, or for genomes and gene families.

label: Sequence assembly
definitions: Combine (align and merge) overlapping fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.

For example, assemble overlapping reads from paired-end sequencers into contigs (a contiguous sequence corresponding to read overlaps). Or assemble contigs, for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments, depending on the detected fragment overlaps.

label: Gene expression clustering
definitions: Perform cluster analysis of gene expression data to identify groups with similar gene-expression profiles, for example by clustering.

label: Gene expression profiling
definitions: The measurement of the gene expression of multiple genes in a cell, tissue, sample etc., in order to get an impression of biological function.
Metagenomic inference is the profiling of phylogenetic marker genes in order to predict metagenome function.
Gene expression profiling generates some sort of gene expression profile, for example from microarray data.

label: Gene expression comparison
definitions: Comparison of gene expression profiles.

label: Protein secondary structure assignment
definitions: Assign secondary structure from protein coordinate or experimental data.

label: Protein structure assignment
definitions: Assign a protein tertiary structure (3D coordinates), or other aspects of protein structure, from raw experimental data.

label: Protein model validation
definitions: Evaluate the quality or correctness a protein three-dimensional model.

This includes methods that calculate poor quality residues. The scoring function to identify poor quality residues may consider residues with bad atoms or atoms with high B-factor, residues in the N- or C-terminal position, adjacent to an unstructured residue, non-canonical residues, glycine and proline (or adjacent to these such residues).

Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes (bumps), volume irregularities, agreement with electron density maps, number of amino acid residues, percentage of residues with missing or bad atoms, irregular Ramachandran Z-scores, irregular Chi-1 / Chi-2 normality scores, RMS-Z score on bonds and angles etc.

The PDB file format has had difficulties, inconsistencies and errors. Corrections can include identifying a meaningful sequence, removal of alternate atoms, correction of nomenclature problems, removal of incomplete residues and spurious waters, addition or removal of water, modelling of missing side chains, optimisation of cysteine bonds, regularisation of bond lengths, bond angles and planarities etc.

label: Molecular model refinement
definitions: Refine (after evaluation) a model of a molecular structure (typically a protein structure) to reduce steric clashes, volume irregularities etc.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation
definitions: Construct a phylogenetic tree.
Phylogenetic trees are usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated.

label: Phylogenetic tree analysis
definitions: Analyse an existing phylogenetic tree or trees, typically to detect features or make predictions.

label: Phylogenetic tree comparison
definitions: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees.
For example, to produce a consensus tree, subtrees, supertrees, calculate distances between trees or test topological similarity between trees (e.g. a congruence index) etc.

label: Phylogenetic tree editing
definitions: Edit a phylogenetic tree.

label: Phylogenetic footprinting / shadowing
definitions: Infer a phylogenetic tree by comparing orthologous sequences in different species, particularly many closely related species (phylogenetic shadowing).

A phylogenetic 'shadow' represents the additive differences between individual sequences. By masking or 'shadowing' variable positions a conserved sequence is produced with few or none of the variations, which is then compared to the sequences of interest to identify significant regions of conservation.

label: Protein modelling (mutation)
definitions: Predict the effect of point mutation on a protein structure, in terms of strucural effects and protein folding, stability and function.

This includes 1) rotamer likelihood prediction: the prediction of rotamer likelihoods for all 20 amino acid types at each position in a protein structure, where output typically includes, for each residue position, the likelihoods for the 20 amino acid types with estimated reliability of the 20 likelihoods.  2) Protein SNP mapping, which maps and modesl the effects of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) on protein structure(s).  Methods might predict silent or pathological mutations.

label: Enzyme kinetics calculation
definitions: Calculate Km, Vmax and derived data for an enzyme reaction.

label: Formatting
definitions: Reformat a file of data (or equivalent entity in memory).

label: Format validation
definitions: Test and validate the format and content of a data file.

label: Visualisation
definitions: Visualise, plot or render (graphically) biomolecular data such as molecular sequences or structures.

label: Sequence database search
definitions:
Search a sequence database by sequence comparison and retrieve similar sequences.
sequences matching a given sequence motif or pattern, such as a Prosite pattern or regular expression.
This excludes direct retrieval methods (e.g. the dbfetch program).

label: Structure database search
definitions: Search a tertiary structure database, typically by sequence and/or structure comparison, or some other means, and retrieve structures and associated data.

label: Sequence similarity search
definitions: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences that are similar to a query sequence.

label: Sequence database search (by property)
definitions: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences with a specified property, typically a physicochemical or compositional property.

label: Structural similarity search
definitions: Search a database of molecular structure and retrieve structures that are similar to a query structure.

label: Sequence annotation
definitions: Annotate a molecular sequence record with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Genome annotation
definitions: Annotate a genome sequence with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Nucleic acid sequence reverse and complement
definitions: Generate the reverse and / or complement of a nucleotide sequence.

label: Random sequence generation
definitions: Generate a random sequence, for example, with a specific character composition.

label: Nucleic acid restriction digest
definitions: Generate digest fragments for a nucleotide sequence containing restriction sites.

label: Protein sequence cleavage
definitions: Cleave a protein sequence into peptide fragments (corresponding to enzymatic or chemical cleavage).

label: Sequence mutation and randomisation
definitions: Mutate a molecular sequence a specified amount or shuffle it to produce a randomised sequence with the same overall composition.

label: Sequence masking
definitions: Mask characters in a molecular sequence (replacing those characters with a mask character).
For example, SNPs or repeats in a DNA sequence might be masked.

label: Sequence cutting
definitions: Cut (remove) characters or a region from a molecular sequence.

label: Restriction site creation
definitions: Create (or remove) restriction sites in sequences, for example using silent mutations.

label: DNA translation
definitions: Translate a DNA sequence into protein.

label: DNA transcription
definitions: Transcribe a nucleotide sequence into mRNA sequence(s).

label: Repeat sequence detection
definitions: Find (and possibly render) short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in (typically nucleotide) sequences.

label: Repeat sequence organisation analysis
definitions: Analyse repeat sequence organisation such as periodicity.

label: Accessible surface calculation
definitions: Calculate solvent accessible or buried surface areas in protein or other molecular structures.
Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).

label: Protein dipole moment calculation
definitions: Calculate whether a protein structure has an unusually large net charge (dipole moment).

label: Molecular surface calculation
definitions: Calculate the molecular surface area in proteins and other macromolecules.

label: Protein-nucleic acid binding site analysis
definitions: Analyse RNA or DNA-binding sites in protein structure.

label: Protein peeling
definitions: Decompose a structure into compact or globular fragments (protein peeling).

label: Protein distance matrix calculation
definitions: Calculate a matrix of distance between residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

label: Protein contact map calculation
definitions: Calculate a residue contact map (typically all-versus-all inter-residue contacts) for a protein structure.

label: Residue cluster calculation
definitions: Calculate clusters of contacting residues in protein structures.
This includes for example clusters of hydrophobic or charged residues, or clusters of contacting residues which have a key structural or functional role.

label: Hydrogen bond calculation
definitions: Identify potential hydrogen bonds between amino acids and other groups.
The output might include the atoms involved in the bond, bond geometric parameters and bond enthalpy.

label: Ramachandran plot calculation
definitions: Calculate a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

label: Ramachandran plot validation
definitions: Validate a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

label: Protein molecular weight calculation
definitions: Calculate the molecular weight of a protein sequence or fragments.

label: Protein extinction coefficient calculation
definitions: Predict extinction coefficients or optical density of a protein sequence.

label: Protein pKa calculation
definitions: Calculate pH-dependent properties from pKa calculations of a protein sequence.

label: Protein titration curve plotting
definitions: Plot a protein titration curve.

label: Protein isoelectric point calculation
definitions: Calculate isoelectric point of a protein sequence.

label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate calculation
definitions: Estimate hydrogen exchange rate of a protein sequence.

label: Protein hydrophobic region calculation
definitions: Calculate hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions of a protein sequence.

label: Protein aliphatic index calculation
definitions: Calculate aliphatic index (relative volume occupied by aliphatic side chains) of a protein.

label: Protein hydrophobic moment plotting
definitions: Calculate the hydrophobic moment of a peptide sequence and recognize amphiphilicity.
Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

label: Protein globularity prediction
definitions: Predict the stability or globularity of a protein sequence, whether it is intrinsically unfolded etc.

label: Protein solubility prediction
definitions: Predict the solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence.

label: Protein crystallizability prediction
definitions: Predict crystallizability of a protein sequence.

label: Nucleic acid feature detection
definitions: Predict, recognise and identify features in nucleotide sequences such as functional sites or regions, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.
